title: Enrollment Specialist
description:
**Bronx Community Health Network**

**Job Title:** Enrollment Specialist

**Schedule:** Monday – Friday 9:00am – 5:30pm

**Supervisor:** Chief Medical Officer

**Department**: Clinical Administration

**Job Type:** Full-Time 37.5 hours weekly

**FLSA:** Non-Exempt

**Salary:** $40k -$50k

Come join our amazing team of dedicated healthcare workers!

**Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN)** was founded in 1996 to ensure that the socio-economically depressed and medically underserved residents of the Bronx have access to high-quality and comprehensive healthcare services, Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN) is a not-for-profit, community-based organization and Federally Qualified Health Center. The organization provides a wide range of comprehensive, coordinated primary medical, oral, and mental health care and related diagnostic, pharmacy, social support, and enabling services for medically underserved/uninsured residents.

**BCHN’s mission**: To improve the health of people and families in the Bronx; provide access to affordable, quality health care, especially for uninsured persons; promote disease prevention, early treatment and healthful lifestyles; and obtain financial and other resources for programs and services. BCHN’s service area includes the entire borough of the Bronx, including all 25 zip codes. Within this area, Health Center sites focus on the low-income and underserved populations.

BCHN is seeking to hire an Enrollment Specialist to help patients’ complete insurance applications and enroll in a plan.

**About the Role:** The Enrollment Specialist will effectively communicate coverage information to patients, and interpret complex information, including processes, procedures, and legal/regulatory requirements. Responsible for performing various data entry functions.

· Assisting patients in understanding insurance choices, federal tax subsidies, public plans, plan benefits, co-payment and other cost-sharing expenses

· Completing enrollment process for clients, following case from initial file set-up to completion

· Educating consumers on their benefits and responsibilities under Affordable Care Act

· Contacting NY State of Health to resolve issues, as needed.

· Facilitating selection of a qualified health plan to consumers who are applying for health insurance coverage at the time of application and at renewals.

· Assuring that all applications are accurately completed and submitted on time, adhering to current submission guidelines.

· Meeting productivity and quality performance targets

· Performing services in a culturally competent manner, considering individual needs with regard to language, disability access, and reading level

· Referring consumers to other organizations for help with grievances, complaints, or questions regarding health coverage or a determination related to coverage.

· Maintaining strict confidentiality and privacy standards

· Ability to successfully execute multiple tasks simultaneously.

· Follow best practice and clinical standards and adhere to departmental and NY State guidelines.

· Support the Health Center administrative goals and requirements.

· Checks and verifies that all documents are complete and ready for submission.

· Perform other duties as requested by management.

**Qualifications:**

· High School Diploma or GED (Required)

· More than two (2) years of equivalent experience

**Special Skills and Knowledge:**

· Strong computer skills required.

· Experience with Excel and PowerPoint preferred.

· Ability to maintain detailed documentation and records in an organized manner.

· Ability to work as a team member and independently.

· Must be able to remain in a stationary position for prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

· Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.

· Basic knowledge of medical terminology

· Excellent active listening skills and strong service orientation

Bronx Community Health Network is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender dysphoria, national origin, age, religion, disability, military and veteran status, marital or parental status, citizenship status, genetic information or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $37,599.00 - $50,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Integrated Evidence Plan (IEP) Director
description:
ROLE SUMMARY*The Platform:* The Chief Medical Affairs Office’s Real-World Evidence (RWE) Platform is responsible for establishing global scientific leadership and stature through the generation of integrated, end-to-end observational real-world evidence serving all therapeutic areas from proof of concept (POC) trials through LOE for priority pipeline candidates, pipeline supplementation through business development, and marketed inline products. The Platform fully centralizes RWE, epidemiology, outcomes research, RW-relevant health informatics, and biostatistics talent from global, international developed market (IDM) and emerging markets (EM) into one team to drive efficiency through internalized work.
The RWE Platform functions to:
enhance Pfizer’s ability to determine unmet medical needs; support differentiated product labels for Product Development programs including finding alternatives and accelerated licensure pathways for new indications through the use of Real-World Data (RWD), Real World Insights (RWI) and Real World Evidence (RWE); inform clinical practice on appropriate prescription and use of Pfizer’s products; in collaboration with Access & Value, strengthen the value evidence package for payers and access/policy decision-makers; support measurement of short- and long-term impact of Pfizer’s products to both patients and populations; support competitive differentiation.*The Opportunity:*
This position will assume a key leadership role within the RWE Platform organization, serving as Director in the Business Operations & Integrated Evidence Planning (IEP) Success Team.
This role provides operational expertise and project management leadership for several RWE initiatives of high complexity across multiple categories and above categories. By developing and implementing best practices in project management and process improvements, the candidate will help establish Pfizer as an industry leader in generation and use of Real-World Evidence for drug development. Critical success factors include excellent communication skills, industry savvy, effective collaboration with Pfizer enterprise departments, mastery of complex financial systems, and understanding of how to drive sound portfolio decision analyses and planning.
The Director leads PM activities to deliver cost-effective, timely and high-quality Real-World Evidence, Real World Data and Real World Insights across the products’ lifecycle from Proof of Concept (POC) through loss of exclusivity (LOE). They will ensure delivery of critically important work products such as the Integrated Evidence Plans (IEPs). They may also play a key role in other activities including Op Planning, inclusion of RWE evidence generation into DP3 requests, expertly tracking budgetary sourcing/spending; maintaining high quality, continuous portfolio data availability and analytics; or other duties as assigned.
Consequently, this is a position for a skilled motivated individual who enjoys the challenge and excitement of identifying and deploying best practices in PM to ensure success of the team and Pfizer.
ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES
Key strategic deliverables include:* Provides day to day project management oversight supporting one of the RWE Platform’s most important projects: development and deployment of Integrated Evidence Plans (IEP) for all priority assets.
* Builds bridges across category stakeholders as a key player in the successful development and integration of the RWE Platform to achieve a One Pfizer vision for RWE/RWD/RWI generation. Connects with all other relevant Project Management organizations.
* Leads and ensures accurate and timely budget management across all sources of funding for RWE projects. Establishes clear and efficient processes for sourcing funding from business partners across the enterprise.
* Identifies need for, drives development, implementation, maintenance, and improvement of project management methodologies within the RWE Platform and the broader organization, where appropriate, leveraging the best practices identified across the organization and beyond.


Operational Delivery* Provides accurate milestones, timelines and budgets management for RWE projects to ensure delivery against goals (cost, speed, quality).
* Develops and oversees process frameworks helping category teams manage RWE Platform deliverables aligned to program strategic plans. (such as the IEP)
* Establishes processes and tools for timely and accurate portfolio reporting, creation of briefing documents and communications.
* Maintains portfolio systems and capabilities to support RWE Platform scope in collaboration with the CMAO’s Operational Excellence and Quality/Compliance teams.
* Plays a key role in many financial processes including Op Planning, DP3, Quarterly budget reviews under the supervision of Head of Business Operations & IEP Success.
* May be responsible for RWE Platform committees planning and execution.


Partner Line and Stakeholder Management* Responsible for developing and fostering strong working relationship with key Pfizer partners across categories, regions, and departments. Identify and implement process improvements to ensure alignment with the evolving Pfizer operational and financial governance processes.
* Coordinates effectively with PRD Project & Portfolio Management as well as with Pfizer Digital.
* Represents the team at business venues, meeting, conferences, interactions with external and internal stakeholders.


Supervision* Individual contributor, but might have the opportunity to manage others as the group expands.
* Leads teams in a matrix-based organization; develops and implements PM tools enabling consistent execution of RWE projects to drive decision making that maximizes business value culminating in high quality strategic and operational delivery within budget constraints.


Talent Development and Performance* Aligns and motivates colleagues behind the RWE Platform’s Vision.
* Fosters leadership and continuous improvement methodologies, leveraging innovative ideas to develop colleague’s skills and ensure the RWE Platform can become/stay the best in the industry.
* Helps identify and recruit key talent and retain them by contributing to building a vibrant culture within the RWE Platform group.


BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact.* Bachelor's degree in one of the disciplines related to drug development or business management and at least 10 years of experience working in the pharmaceutical industry, with at least 7 years managing multiple, highly complex projects and portfolio governance; Masters degree + 8+ years; PharmD/PHD + 6+ years
* Strong financial acumen, experience managing multi-line complex budgets, including tracking of finances and FTEs.
* Excellent communicator comfortable presenting to senior leadership.
* In-depth knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry in general, and specific knowledge of drug development.


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS* Advanced scientific (MS, PhD, MD) or business (MBA) degree is preferred.
* Formal training or certification in project management methodologies (PMP, six sigma, Agile)
* Strong contributor to strategic planning with leadership teams and track record of implementation success.
* Strong technical experience in a discipline associated with drug development/commercialization.
* Demonstrated success negotiating in a highly matrix-based organization.
* Strong track record meeting personal and team goals.
* Proven record of implementing portfolio management practices and process improvements.
* Understands R&D portfolio pipeline and in-line asset strategic objectives to effectively ensure tactical implementation.
* Clear understanding of resource management at team and portfolio level.
* Hands-on experience in governance management and portfolio reporting.
* Demonstrated understanding of stakeholder risk management and mitigation strategies to simulate the likely obstacles to project progression.
* Experience utilizing project management software programs such as MS Project, Planisware, Jira, etc.


NON-STANDARD WORK SCHEDULE, TRAVEL OR ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS
Travel of 5-10%, depending on budgets and COVID restrictions.
Other Job Details:
Last Date to Apply for Job: September 18, 2024
Additional Location Information: New York, NY; Collegeville, PA; Cambridge, MA; La Jolla, CA; Lake Forest, IL; Groton, CT; Bothell, WA; Boulder, CO; Tampa, FL; South San Francisco, CA; Europe - Any Pfizer site
Eligible for Relocation Package: No
The annual base salary for this position ranges from $161,600.00 to $269,400.00.\\* In addition, this position is eligible for participation in Pfizer’s Global Performance Plan with a bonus target of 20.0% of the base salary and eligibility to participate in our share based long term incentive program. We offer comprehensive and generous benefits and programs to help our colleagues lead healthy lives and to support each of life’s moments. Benefits offered include a 401(k) plan with Pfizer Matching Contributions and an additional Pfizer Retirement Savings Contribution, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage. Learn more at Pfizer Candidate Site – U.S. Benefits | (uscandidates.mypfizerbenefits.com). Pfizer compensation structures and benefit packages are aligned based on the location of hire. The United States salary range provided does not apply to Tampa, FL or any location outside of the United States.* The annual base salary for this position in Tampa, FL ranges from $145,400.00 to $242,400.00.


Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs and/or eligibility.
Sunshine Act
Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.
EEO & Employment Eligibility
Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. title: Director, US Marketing and Alliance Operations
description:
ROLE SUMMARY
TIVDAK is a treatment for patients with recurrent/metastatic cervical cancer that received FDA approval in September 2021 and launched with our co-promote partner, Genmab. TIVDAK volume and utilization has grown quarter over quarter since its approval and continues to deliver growth in early 2024. This is an exciting opportunity to work on a fast-paced, co-promote with a high performing team and to support patients with advanced cervical cancer.
The TIVDAK Team is seeking a highly motivated Director, US Marketing and Alliance Operations. This new role will be responsible for ensuring commercial excellence in project and relationship management (external partnerships and alliances), as well as leading key HCP marketing initiatives. This individual will work collaboratively with key internal and external stakeholders to coordinate, manage, and deliver seamless execution of commercial strategic objectives. The Director will also be accountable for continuously improving global processes that ensure high quality support of company strategies and objectives.
The role will report to the US Team Lead for TIVDAK.
ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES* Serve as partner coordination point, working closely with Alliance management, internal team members, and senior leaders to manage and advance joint goals and deliverables. Accountable for ensuring seamless communication and execution between commercial teams and broader alliance efforts.
* Lead multiple HCP marketing workstreams, while providing input on strategy, tactical planning, and the ongoing efforts to drive innovation, optimize reach and customer engagement with invested tactics.
* Lead the coordination of day-to-day alliance activities, ensuring successful execution of deliverables and progress to defined objectives. Ensure operating norms (e.g. communication, decision making) for partner interactions are established and adhered to.
* Proactively monitor and communicate contractual obligations and deliverables to relevant stakeholders to ensure responsibilities met in accordance with terms of collaboration.
* Partner closely with team members to ensure joint decisions are implemented in alignment with product goals, alliance operating principles and contractual terms.
* Drive joint process management including proactively identifying potential conflicts and managing issues to resolution while fostering and maintaining collaborative working relationships. Facilitate effective governance and decision making.
* Facilitate the identification, management, and communication of key risks, associated mitigation, contingency plans, and appropriate escalation in partnership with program alliance managers.
* Work closely with internal joint committee members, functional leaders, and leadership to ensure ongoing alignment, prepare for key engagements, and manage points of operational friction.
* Collaborate with members across the program to develop and maintain high-quality, project plans that align with overall program goals and commercialization strategies and drive communication, scenario planning and decision making accordingly.
* Implement stage appropriate and value-added processes, best practices, commercial frameworks, and appropriate cadences to increase efficiency and consistency of commercial processes/deliverables.
* Oversee project management leadership and support for key commercial activities including functional sub-teams, working group meetings, commercial launch planning, and various commercial projects.


BASIC QUALIFICATIONS* BA/BS required, advanced degree preferred
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in the pharmaceutical, life sciences or related industry – experience in oncology is desirable.
* Demonstrated skills in operationalizing data management for sharing across organizations.
* Marketing and sales experience preferred.
* People management or cross-functional leadership experiences in related functions is strongly preferred.
* Experience working on alliances and/or executing complex commercial agreements required.
* Experience with global partners preferred.
* Experience working with and managing cross-functional teams, including senior leadership and joint leadership committees, to accomplish shared goals required.
* Strong business acumen with demonstrated ability to rapidly develop and implement solutions that support product, team, corporate and alliance objectives.
* A proactive and agile thinker, with strong facilitation, problem-solving and issue resolution skills.
* Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to facilitate internal and external alignment, as well as effectively and diplomatically negotiate and resolve conflict.
* Highly collaborative with outstanding communication and relationship management skills, high emotional intelligence.
* Proven ability to influence teams without formal authority.
* Understanding of US market dynamics
* Helps foster a culture of collaboration and teamwork

  

  

Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact.
NON-STANDARD WORK SCHEDULE, TRAVEL OR ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS* The individual must be able to travel. Minimum of 25% of international and domestic travel required.


Other Job Details:* Last day to apply: September 18, 2024


Work Location Assignment: On Premise at a designated Pfizer North America Location
The annual base salary for this position ranges from $149,200.00 to $248,600.00. In addition, this position is eligible for participation in Pfizer’s Global Performance Plan with a bonus target of 20.0% of the base salary and eligibility to participate in our share based long term incentive program. We offer comprehensive and generous benefits and programs to help our colleagues lead healthy lives and to support each of life’s moments. Benefits offered include a 401(k) plan with Pfizer Matching Contributions and an additional Pfizer Retirement Savings Contribution, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage. title: 3rd Shift Production Packaging Associate
description:
**Location Address:**


4 Pleasant Hill Road, Monroe Township, New Jersey 08831**Work Shift:**


8hr-3rd Shift (United States of America)
The Production Packaging Associate is an entry level position, responsible for proper packaging of materials and finished products. This position will also load, move material, and operate packaging equipment. The Production Packaging Associate will also be required to follow Good Manufacturing Practices.
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

* Demonstrates safe work practices by wearing correct PPE and following safety policies.
* Demonstrates punctuality and adheres to work schedule.
* Demonstrates a Teamwork attitude by working well and effectively with others.
* Adheres to company General Manufacturing Policies.
* Keeps the work area neat, clean, and organized.
* Monitor conveyor belts and clear bottle jams from lines.
* Pick up dropped bottles from production floor and place into designated bins.
* Place discarded bottles into grinder, if applicable.
* Inspects the quality of bottles during production, packaging, and labeling.
* Performs bottle inspections, such as drop tests for designated lines.
* Immediately escalates all bottle abnormalities, defects and quality issues when found.
* Monitor supply levels of packaging materials and replenish as needed.
* Ensure correct labeling, bottle description and packaging of product in accordance with specific customer requirements.
* Move finished goods to designated area.
* Ensure efficient set up and organization of workstations. Maintain inventory levels and restock supplies as needed to facilitate smooth transitions between shifts
* Other duties as assigned by management.
* Duties may differentiate by plant based on equipment and plant design.
**QUALIFICATIONS:**


The requirements listed below are minimum requirements for the job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with


disabilities who are otherwise qualified to safely perform the essential functions of the job, unless such accommodation would impose an


undue hardship on the Company.

**EXPERIENCE:**

* Basic mathematical skills are required.
* Basic computer experience.

**EDUCATION:**

* Prefer High School diploma or general education degree (GED).


TRAINING:

* Completion of Altium Production/Packaging Associate I, training within 90 days of hire date.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential


functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities who are otherwise qualified to safely


perform the essential functions of the job unless such accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the Company. While performing


the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; use hands to grasp, handle, or feel; reach out, over and below with hands and arms.


The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, and or crawl. The employee frequently is required to lift, push, pull, and/or move up to 50 pounds.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT:**


While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts in a production environment. The


noise level in the work environment is usually loud. Temperatures inside the plant can fluctuate between hot and cold according to seasonal


changes. Personal protective equipment (PPE) is required in the production department and other designated areas.

title: Director, US Comirnaty Adult External Engagement Lead
description:
ROLE SUMMARY
Vaccines is the only place in Pfizer where you can contribute to patients in a way like no other – you can prevent sickness and disease. This is at the heart of what drives us every day and it brings us great #Joy. It is a remarkable time to be part of Pfizer’s US Vaccines business as it expands on its mission of preventing disease and improving public health.
Join the team that contributed to ending the COVID-19 pandemic. It’s a testament to our collective innovation, dedication, and agility to contribute to humanity. Our efforts not only brought hope and healing to millions but also forged a path for a safer future. Now, we’re embarking on the mission to build the COVID-19 immunization market post-pandemic as we remain vigilant against the mutating virus. Come and craft a legacy of enduring impact as we shape a healthier world.
It’s a fast-paced, collaborative environment that requires an experienced leader who has worked in competitive markets and can work effectively across cross-functional partners. As the work evolves, priorities change, and needs arise, the individual may need to flex across several content areas to support/drive the work.
ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES
The US Comirnaty Adult External Engagement Lead will operate in an exciting, fast-paced, and dynamic environment leading all US Adult Comirnaty peer to peer marketing initiatives which remain imperative to deliver key information and education to HCPs. This individual should have experience in creating tailored ways of engaging with external stakeholders and demonstrate the ability to move fast in response to what is happening in the marketplace.
Responsibilities:* Lead Adult Comirnaty peer to peer commercial planning and strategy
* Development of end-to-end congress, webinars, social/digital engagements, often in collaboration with Vx portfolio
* Develop strategic P2P presence and engagement based on metric/analytics evaluation and customer and channel insights
* Lead competitive strategy for COMIRNATY including insight sharing, and collaborating with global CI colleagues and colleagues across the COMIRNATY Adult team for insights
* Collaborate with Brand Strategy HCP lead and Omnichannel team to iterate on burden of disease and clinical messaging
* Lead commercial KOL engagements such as ad boards and speaker panels
* Evolve US Comirnaty speaker bureau and serve as point for speaker training and programs
* Coach brand manager who supports external engagement execution, including congresses and speaker decks
* Work seamlessly across cross functional team members including (but not limited to) HCP omnichannel team, Vx portfolio, global, medical, legal, and HEOR
* Support annual operating and tactical plan development process, focused on HCP strategy and activation
* Manage P2P agency and be responsible for all strategy, tactical planning, and budget oversight
* Collaborate with Operations Director to manage overall HCP brand strategy budget


QUALIFICATIONS
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS* BA or BS required
* 10+ years of commercial experience
* Strong familiarity with US healthcare landscape including HCP's, medical groups/integrated delivery networks, payers, and consumers
* Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including agile way of working, solution oriented, the ability to influence and collaborate with peers and create business impact
* Demonstrated strategic thinking, analytical and project management skills
* Innovative thinker who is excited by “pioneering” initiatives that may not have precedent
* Strong oral and written communication skills
* Ability to engage and influence team members, even without direct reporting relationships
* Uphold Pfizer’s Core Values of Excellence, Equity, Courage and Joy, while contributing to a positive and collaborative team cultures


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS* Advanced degree
* Prior Vaccines experience
* Prior congress planning experience
* Champion innovation, seek learnings from other brands and other industries to innovate and enhance plans
* Agile mindset; Track record of pushing boundaries and not accepting status quo


Other Job Details:* Last day to apply: September 18, 2024


The annual base salary for this position ranges from $149,200.00 to $248,600.00. In addition, this position is eligible for participation in Pfizer’s Global Performance Plan with a bonus target of 20.0% of the base salary and eligibility to participate in our share based long term incentive program. We offer comprehensive and generous benefits and programs to help our colleagues lead healthy lives and to support each of life’s moments. Benefits offered include a 401(k) plan with Pfizer Matching Contributions and an additional Pfizer Retirement Savings Contribution, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage. Learn more at Pfizer Candidate Site – U.S. Benefits | (uscandidates.mypfizerbenefits.com). Pfizer compensation structures and benefit packages are aligned based on the location of hire. The United States salary range provided does not apply to Tampa, FL or any location outside of the United States.
Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs and/or eligibility.
Sunshine Act
Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.
EEO & Employment Eligibility
Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer. This position requires permanent work authorization in the United States.
Marketing and Market Research

title: Armed Driver/Messenger
description:
GardaWorld is shaping the future of cash management! We provide our clients with solutions in every phase of their cash supply chain, including secured transportation, cash management, cash vault processing, forecasting, ATM, and cash recycler services. We are equipped with the largest fleet of armored vehicles in the industry, sophisticated technology, and an expansive network of experienced employees and innovative partners. We process, manage, and move over $8B in cash every day while delivering 24/7 client support and logistical expertise.
  
  

**Full-Time Employee Benefits Include:**  

* 401K
* Health Insurance (Medical, Dental Vision)
* PTO
* Exclusive Employees Perks (Cell plans, Auto Service, Finance/ Legal Services and much more)


**YOUR JOB:**  

If you are over 21, enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and seek new challenges, a position as an armored truck Driver/Messenger might be right for you. In this role, you are responsible for the safe and efficient transportation of valuables, so you need to be comfortable with some heavy lifting. Your strong people skills mean you act in a professional manner and enjoy interacting with customers to develop a rapport that meets our high standards of customer service. You are responsible for issuing and receiving confirmation receipts to verify each transfer. Safety and security are huge priorities at GardaWorld Cash, so you will be expected to follow the highest levels of driver safety in all weather conditions and be vigilant in all areas for our customers, your colleagues, and the community. All positions are armed, so you will be required to have and maintain the necessary licenses for your area to work as an armored truck driver/messenger.
  
  

**WHO YOU ARE:**  

* 21 years of age or older with a valid and clean driver’s license
* Have or be able to obtain and maintain active guard and firearm permits or licenses on a current basis as required by state regulations.
* Have strong customer service skills and can communicate effectively in person and by radio.
* Are willing to operate large vehicles in all weather and traffic conditions. Heavy lifting required (50lbs+)


GardaWorld is an equal opportunity employer and drug free workplace. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, protected veteran status or disability.
  
  

Cash Services Headquarters
  
2000 NW Corporate Boulevard
  
Boca Raton, Florida, USA
  
33431
  
+ 1 561 939 7000
company_description: GardaWorld is one of the largest privately owned integrated physical security, cash management and risk management companies in the world.

title: Branch Banking Client Consultant I (Part Time)
description:
Position Title
Branch Banking Client Consultant I (Part Time)
Location
Brooklyn/1268 Broadway/110311
Job Summary
A Branch Banking Client Consultant I provides customers with high quality, prompt, and professional financial services. Responsible for interacting with clients and providing exceptional service by greeting them as they enter one of our branches and providing them with the services needed to meet their financial goals. This role will process financial transactions in an accurate, efficient, and friendly manner while maintaining operational standards, and assist the team in meeting branch goals.  

  

Pay Range: $17.00 - $21.25 - $25.50
Pay Range: Local Minimum Wage - $0.00 - $0.00
Job Responsibilities:* Sales Performance: Support team efforts to achieve growth targets in financial performance (outstanding deposits, outstanding loans, non-interest income) and primary client acquisition. Actively seek and deliver the right client introductions to the right team member(s) to achieve growth targets and execute successful sales initiative
* Client Experience: Provide positive client experience by assisting with account questions, problems and/or complaints and through research and communication resolve in a timely and effective manner. Delivers client engagement and Education. Meet behavioral activity goals as defined by Retail Leadership including, but not limited to referrals.
* Management: Deliver timely and accurate daily financial transactions; striving for no controllable preventable losses. Understand and adhere to all applicable bank policies and regulations.
* Performs special projects, and additional duties and responsibilities as required.
* Consistently adheres to regulatory and compliance policies and standards linked to the job as listed and complete required compliance trainings. Accountable to maintain compliance with applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations.


Job Requirements:* High School / High School Equivalency (GED, HiSET, TASC) / Foreign Equivalent, required
* 0 – 3 years of customer service and sales experience, required
* Experience in financial services industry, preferred

description:

Compensation Consultant
Location
Hicksville/102 Duffy Avenue/3797
Job Summary
Pay Range: $71,600.00 - $87,947.00 - $132,600.00
Job Responsibilities:
The Compensation Consultant partners with line of business (and potentially the Compensation Consultant Lead) and leadership to align compensation programs with business goals and objectives. description:
Position Title
Associate Group Director
Location
New York/1400 Broadway/114025

The Associate Group Director works to provide personalized banking solutions to clients in the Private Banking Group.
Pay Range: $35,568.00 - $66,534.00 - $97,500.00
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities Include:
Develops prospects from current commercial customers, referral leads, and other sources.
Generates new business to assist in meeting bank profitability goals including business plan growth, income objectives, controlling expense to maintain profitability.

title: Porter at Stony Brook University Hospital
description:
ASA's Mission is to maintain and enhance the quality, diversity, cost, and value of food in the campus dining programs, improving fiscally prudent and affordable food plans for students While ensuring the availability of desired and appropriate merchandise, products, and services for the campus community; Fostering and supporting the campus' core mission of academics, research, scholarship and intellectual creativity, inclusivity, and sustainability
  
  

**Position Summary:**  

The Porter at Stony Brook Hospital is an ancillary employee who performs various cleaning tasks, maintaining clean and sanitary conditions in all food service areas. Responsibilities include dishwashing, general sanitation, cleaning, and using kitchen equipment. The Porter may also assist in the service and storage of food.
  
  

**1199 Union Position:** Porters are employees of the Auxiliary Services Association. The 1199 Union provides health and retirement benefits after completion of the probationary period.
  
  

**\\*\\*Essential Position:** This position is considered "Essential." The incumbent must report to work regardless of extreme weather or other conditions. \\*\\*
  
  

**Position Details:** Local 1199 Union
  
**FLSA Status:** Non-exempt
  
**Rate of Pay:** $21.77 Hourly (Contractual increases afterward)
  
**Schedule:** Weekends and Holidays required. (Availability starting at 4pm)
  
  

**Benefits:**  

* Dental and Health Insurance
* Paid time off
* Employee Assistance Program
* 403(b)
* Employee Discount Program


**Required Qualifications:**  

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Excellent customer service skills
* Must be able to read, write, and speak English, follow written and verbal instructions, and complete simple computational skills
* Ability to meet travel requirements associated with this position
* Ability to meet acceptable background check standards
* Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends, as appropriate.


**Preferred Qualifications:**  

* Experience in the healthcare environment


**Program/Department Responsibilities:**  

* Operate and clean assigned equipment per departmental procedures.
* Safely transport garbage and recyclable material to designated areas.
* Accurately deliver food and supplies to identified areas and clean as per departmental policy and procedures.
* Maintain assigned departmental areas in a clean, orderly, and sanitary manner,
* Demonstrate knowledge of federal, state, local, and department and follow directions recommended by manufacturers and per SDS sheets.
* Demonstrate knowledge of infection control.
* Demonstrate knowledge of sanitation, including but not limited to food safety and personal hygiene.
* Complete food temperature control logs as per established protocol.
* Accurately inventory and maintain necessary supplies to ensure efficiency of operation.
* Identify and utilize cleaning chemicals used in the department following the manufacturer's directions and MSDS sheets.
* Perform other duties as assigned by the supervisor.


**Environmental Care/Infection Control Responsibilities:**  

* Safety: Follow Association and departmental safety policies and procedures, including occurrence reporting.
* Security: Wear name tag identification and be aware of the role in minimizing security incidents.
* Hazardous Materials and Waste: Demonstrate knowledge of the role of hazardous materials and waste in the hazardous materials and waste program.
* Emergency Preparedness: Demonstrate knowledge of the role of the Emergency Preparedness Program. Participate in disaster drills, as appropriate.
* Utility Systems: Demonstrate knowledge of the department's response to utility failures.
* Infection Control: Follow Association and departmental Infection Control policies and procedures.


FSA is an employer and educator recognized for valuing AA/EEO and Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities.
  
  

No relocation or VISA Sponsorship is available.
  
FSA may make reasonable accommodations to enable applicants to participate in the hiring process and employees to perform their essential functions. If you require an accommodation to participate in the selection process, you are encouraged to contact Human Resources at (631) 632-9306.

title: Vice President/Professional Banking Team Leader
description:
**General Statement of Duties:**  

The Professional Banking Team Leader directs a dynamic group performing sales and service functions for commercial real estate and residential and mixed-use loan customers and property managers. Services include new accounts, cash management, merchant services referrals, and other business-related products. The Professional Bankers serve as a resource in the loan closing process for account opening, online banking and remote deposit set up, customer assistance and product presentation. They ensure that all accounts required by our loan conditions are properly established and maintained. These may include operating accounts, tenant lease security deposits, or direct debit accounts for mortgage and loan payments. The Professional Bankers routinely assist with service or maintenance needs on their clients’ savings or checking accounts. Through ongoing portfolio management, they build strong relationships with our valued real estate clients.
  
  

**Major Duties and Responsibilities:**  

* Leverage the Bank’s strong commercial real estate and residential and mixed-use lending programs to grow deposit portfolios and identify and refer cash management opportunities.
* Supervise the Professional Banking team to ensure maximum productivity and contribution to the Bank’s deposit growth strategies and goals. Responsible for the employee management process within the department, directing all relevant job positions within the team.
* Accountable for the financial performance of the Professional Banking team, client satisfaction, and adherence to Bank policies and procedures. The Team Leader will identify opportunities to expand the client portfolio by strategically targeting key real estate and property management businesses. Deepen client relationships through allied products and services such as cash management, online escrow, and insured deposits.
* In conjunction with their manager and other leadership, manage and coordinate financial reporting, budgeting and forecasting processes. This includes regular budgeting, expense management, and production reviews. The team leader is responsible for establishing the work schedule, meeting times, managing day-to-day operations, and keeping members on track while ensuring that production goals are met.
* Lead by example, delegate effectively, and align team tasks with individual strengths. Acknowledge challenges, recommend professional development, and communicate clearly and consistently with their manager and team members. Monitor team performance; prepare written performance evaluations; coach, counsel, train, and motivate team to ensure organization, accountability and effectiveness.
* Ensure compliance with all regulations, policies and procedures.
* Perform additional accountabilities, as needed.


**Minimum Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in business, finance or related field or equivalent experience
* Seven + years of progressively responsible experience in the banking or financial industry, including two to five years in a supervisory or managerial position.


**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**  

* Effective sales, marketing, prospecting and client service techniques, along with good verbal and written communications skills.
* Solid financial skills and exceptional attention to detail is crucial for this position.
* Knowledge of loan processing, documentation, closing, lending regulations, and administrative functions.
* Ability to establish a strong community presence and solid professional profile in the business community.
* Demonstrated effective time management skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and accomplish work assignments under required schedules.
* Excellent decision making and prudent judgment skills.
* Ability to work well with business managers, loan officers, support staff, challenging customer situations, and problem accounts.
* Proven track record of achieving sales goals.
* Strong understanding of financial institution policies and procedures.
* Strong communication, sales and business development skills.
* Must be able to work in a team environment as well as independently.


**Pay Range:** $135,000 – $150,000
  
**Hours:** 37.50
  
  

This is an exempt position.
  
The actual compensation will be based on qualifications, experience and other factors permitted by law.
  
  

EOE, including Veterans and Disabled

title: Vice President/Professional Banker
description:
**General Statement of Duties:**  

Responsible for servicing existing client relationships, expanding existing deposit relationships, working closely with loan officers on referrals and self-sourcing other direct business opportunities. Proactively target sales opportunities with a focus on real estate developers and investors and property managers. Establish and maintain contacts with centers of influence and manage and build business customer relationships while ensuring deposit and other sales goals are met. Leverage Bank’s strong commercial real estate and residential and mixed-use lending programs to grow
  
  

**Major Duties and Responsibilities:**  

* Meet or exceed annual goals for deposit acquisition with a primary focus on non-interest DDAs and accounts required by loan covenants.
* Proactively source, acquire, retain, and deepen customer relationships by maximizing sales and lending opportunities.
* Utilize a consultative sales approach to identify new business opportunities and engage clients and prospects in collaborative financial management conversations. Recommend appropriate solutions to facilitate deposit acquisition and prepare or compile new account applications and supporting documents.
* Utilize core data and CRM tools to monitor deposits and transactions with a key focus on maintaining balances required for monthly loan payments, reserve funds, escrow, lease security, and avoiding overdrafts and losses.
* Review and update account data and records as required to meet proper compliance and audit standards.
* Review personal financial statements, business and personal tax returns, and other documents to uncover client needs for cash flow, fraud prevention, online escrow, and lending solutions.
* Establish and grow a book of business, targeting sales opportunities and selling to new and existing customers, with a focus on real estate industry professionals, property managers, and premier (high net worth) consumers.
* Collaborate with loan officers and other Bank partners to deepen relationships with existing clients or introduce business prospects to Flushing Bank’s deposit, credit, online banking, and cash management solutions.
* Initiate and maintain contact with centers of influence (COI’s) and regional or local business organizations to manage and build customer relationships while ensuring sales goals are met.
* Develop and execute calling strategies to target prospects for Flushing Bank’s products and services. Network in person and over the phone with business owners, attorneys, brokers and key decision makers to cross-sell additional products and services to existing customers.
* Represent Flushing Bank in various business, civic, educational, and community functions to enhance the bank’s image and grow the business.
* Engage other units of the bank (including Cash Management; Investments at Flushing Bank; Government Banking; and Business Development) as necessary to establish and expand deposit relationships or offer credit and cash management solutions.
* Participate in sales meetings, sharing best practices, and offering feedback to management on supporting and enhancing team performance.
* Ensure compliance with all regulations, policies and procedures.
* Perform additional accountabilities, as needed.


**Minimum Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in business, finance or related field or equivalent experience
* Five + years of work experience in the banking or financial industry
* Prior experience as a Business Development Officer or Relationship Manager preferred with knowledge of Commercial Real Estate lending and other credit and cash management solutions


**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**  

* Proven track record of achieving sales goals •Strong understanding of financial institution policies and procedures
* Strong communication, sales and business development skills
* Must be able to work in a team environment as well as independently.


**Pay Range:** $95,000 - $120,000
  
**Hours:** 37.50
  
  

This is an exempt position.
  
The actual compensation will be based on qualifications, experience and other factors permitted by law.
  
  

EOE, including Veterans and Disabled

title: Mailroom Clerk
description:
CloudOps Solution is at the forefront of cloud technology, offering innovative solutions that streamline and enhance IT operations for businesses worldwide. Our commitment to excellence and customer satisfaction drives everything we do. We are seeking a dedicated and organized Mailroom Clerk to join our dynamic team and support our administrative operations with efficiency and precision.

**Position Overview:**

As a Mailroom Clerk at CloudOps Solution, you will be the backbone of our mail and package management system. Your role will involve handling incoming and outgoing mail, ensuring timely distribution, and maintaining organized and efficient mailroom operations. If you are detail-oriented, proactive, and enjoy a fast-paced environment, this is the perfect opportunity for you!

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Mail Handling:** Receive, sort, and distribute incoming mail and packages to appropriate departments and personnel in a timely manner.
* **Outgoing Mail:** Prepare and process outgoing mail and shipments, including labeling, weighing, and ensuring compliance with shipping guidelines.
* **Inventory Management:** Monitor and manage mailroom supplies and equipment, ensuring adequate stock levels and maintaining a clean and organized workspace.
* **Record Keeping:** Maintain accurate records of all incoming and outgoing mail, including tracking and reporting any issues or discrepancies.
* **Customer Service:** Provide excellent customer service by assisting employees with mail-related inquiries and ensuring that all mailroom operations run smoothly.
* **Package Handling:** Assist with the receipt and delivery of packages, including handling large or heavy items as needed.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with other administrative staff and departments to coordinate mailroom activities and support overall office operations.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:** High school diploma or equivalent required.
* **Experience:** Previous experience in a mailroom or administrative role is preferred but not required.
* **Skills:** Strong organizational skills with attention to detail; excellent communication and interpersonal skills; ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently.
* **Technical Aptitude:** Familiarity with office equipment such as mail machines, scanners, and computers; basic knowledge of shipping and mailing procedures.
* **Physical Requirements:** Ability to lift and carry packages up to [insert weight] and stand for extended periods.

**Benefits:**

* **Competitive Salary:** A salary that reflects your skills and experience.
* **Comprehensive Benefits:** Health, dental, and vision insurance, along with retirement plan options.
* **Career Development:** Opportunities for professional growth and advancement within a forward-thinking company.
* **Positive Work Environment:** Join a supportive and collaborative team that values your contributions.
* **Work-Life Balance:** Paid time off and holiday pay to support your personal and professional needs.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $27.15 - $30.37 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10022 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10022: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Graphic Designer (Part-Time)
description:
Within the Department of College Relations and under the direct supervision of the Creative Services Manager, this position will support the College’s creative and design needs. This includes creation and preparation, from concept to production, of detailed graphics, conceptual and finished artwork and visual aids for College projects in both digital and physical production-ready formats.
  

**Characteristics, Duties, and Responsibilities**
* Prepare designs and production layouts for brochures, catalogs, presentations, direct mail, college identity, and web/mobile sites

  

* Determine the design, layout and formatting of materials. Integrate typographic, photographic, illustrative and graphic elements

  

**Education Requirements**
* Bachelor’s degree in Fine Arts or Graphic Design is required, BFA is a plus.


  

**Experience**
* 3 years of professional graphic design experience


  

**Competencies and Skills Required**
* Command a thorough knowledge of design and strong expertise in various software applications that focus on design and graphic arts

  

* Demonstrated knowledge of specific software applications including the Adobe Creative Suite and font management software

  

* Proficiency in MAC platform required; working knowledge of PC platform and MS Office programs and ability to work in cross-platform environment are required.

  

* Familiarity and practical knowledge of print production requirements and design for print

  

* Self-starter, ability to identify issues and resolve problems

  

* Understanding of brand management and brand communication

  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
* This position’s duties are normally performed in a typical interior/residence work environment, based on the activity scheduled.

  

* Some physical effort required; however, the employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

  

* No or very limited exposure to physical risk.

title: EVP, Head of Corporate Development & Strategy (Hybrid Options Available)
description:
*Work Locations:* *With the exception of some select roles that have in-office requirements, A+E Networks operates on a flexible model that allows for remote, hybrid or full time in office work (in certain locales).**Office locations include New York City, Los Angeles, Chicago, and Stamford, CT.**Our list of eligible states in which employees may work remotely* *includes: California,* *Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Nevada, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Oregon, South Carolina, South Dakota, Texas, West Virginia, Wisconsin, and Wyoming.*  

Division Story
Most people don’t realize the importance of the Finance department in keeping our business operating without hitches and delays. That’s probably because we oversee many of the more quietly glamorous, back-office functions that drive our bottom line. We not only forecast, build and manage budgets, we also collect and analyze important data that helps leadership make the best decisions. All of this sounds exciting to you because you love numbers and spreadsheets, and especially love great entertainment.
Job Description
The Role: EVP, Head of Corporate Development & Strategy
The EVP, Head of Corporate Development & Strategy will play a pivotal role in driving our strategic direction and growth. You will be responsible for leading the Corporate Development function, which includes board management, M&A, investments, finding organic growth opportunities and a. This role reports into the Chief Financial Officer with a dotted line to our President & Chairman of A+E Networks and will sit on our Executive Team.  

  

Responsibilities* Board Management: Develop materials and financial projections to communicate our business performance and plan to external stakeholders.
* M&A and Investments: Lead M&A and investments from end-to-end from strategy, sourcing, due diligence, execution and integration based on our business strategy and product vision.
* Strategic Projects: Work cross functionally with the executive team to help shape corporate strategy and lead special projects.
* Driving our Growth: Lead organic growth initiatives through new business launches, look for opportunities internally to consult and provide resources to other divisions, amplifying our innovation.
* People and Thought Leadership: Manage and lead a small but mighty Corporate Development team. Provide leadership to company by embodying our values. Show creativity, innovation, and a dedication to our strategy by including principles of diversity, equity, and inclusion in the division’s work and purpose.

  

The Ideal Candidate:* Has experience leading and managing transactions in house.
* Has substantial experience and skills in strategic and financial analysis, complex deal structuring, project management, negotiations, and communication.
* Has launched a new business initiative in the media space (DTC Media, Studio Operations, Digital Publishers, etc.)
* Can tell a story through data and variety of formats (verbal, written, presentations, etc.) and flex to a variety of audiences, both internal and external.
* Has experience working across multiple regions (e.g., Americas, EMEA, APAC) and diverse industries
* Is collaborative and brings an inclusive approach to leadership and problem solving.
* Has experience managing and leading a team.
* Brings a proven track record of creativity and influencing change.
* Thrives in ambiguity.

  

Basic Qualifications* At least 10 years working in corporate development, investment banking, private equity or consulting
* At least 10 years of transactional experience.
* At least 5 years of experience with linear television
* At least 5 years of people management experience
* Able to travel to Stamford, CT or NYC as needed (often on short notice)


Compensation
Annual Pay Range: $422,593 - $507,111
Annual Incentive Target: 40.00% *The annual/hourly**pay range displayed serves as a* *good faith estimate of* *the**minimum and* *maximum* *base* *pay* *range* *for this role.* *Compensation for the role* *will**be based on* *a* *number of different* *factors such as* *a candidate’s qualifications, skills,**competencies,* *location, and* *experience.* *A+E offers a competitive total compensation**package, which* *includes healthcare coverage, 401k matching, and a range of other benefits.* *Learn more at* *aenetworks.com/careers.* *A+E Networks proudly provides equal employment opportunity for all employees and job applicants, and makes employment decisions consistent with this principle. The company’s employment actions and decisions – including recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, demotion, compensation, transfer, layoff, and termination – are made without regard to an employee’s race, color, religion, creed, age, national origin, ancestry, sex (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, and related medical conditions), gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, alienage or citizenship status, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, family and medical leave status, genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.*

title: General Manager
description:
Le Pain Quotidien US and Little Beet Brands came together in 2020 to form Convive Brands. We are looking for an experienced and highly motivated General Manager who is

seriously passionate about hospitality and leading amazing teams for our bustling casual full-service restaurant in New York City. Is that you?!

The General Manager will play a pivotal role in helping the brand and restaurant define its

presence and success in one of New York City’s most visible and vibrant neighborhoods. This is a rare and exciting opportunity for an ambitious and experienced operator who is keen on building a compelling career within a high-growth company.

This role will be responsible for all restaurant operations and will collaborate closely with our District Manager to establish what the ideal guest experience and business profitability look like for the restaurant. The General Manager will have full P&L responsibility and will be the ultimate role model when it comes to building and leading a world-class hospitality restaurant team and an engaging ambassador for the brand.

The ideal candidate will have experience in leading, teaching, and inspiring restaurant teams to execute to high standards, every time. They have hospitality in their bones and will be driven by their passion to create memorable and unique guest experiences through amazing food and guest service, and they will be relentless in their pursuit to drive remarkable business results.

**Role Description**

* Oversee all aspects of the operation within the restaurant, with full oversight of the Front of House and Back of House
* Leads and manages the Bar area. Orders all beer, wine, liquor, and non-alcoholic beverages and bar supplies to pars. Manages beverage vendor accounts, as well as deploying proper staff.
* Deliver the brand's guest experience from beginning to end; provide consistent execution and exemplary service to our guests
* Create and update business strategies for the operation to drive sales
* Manage labor deployment within the parameters of budget
* Direct Front of House and Back of House team to ensure all opening, mid, and closing procedures are followed
* Establish great presence in the neighborhood and drive traffic by creating memorable dining experiences and an inviting restaurant environment; Be the face of hospitality in the restaurant and lead by example with generous hospitality for locals, regulars and first timers.
* Actively work to build restaurant business through leveraging reservation technology and online ordering platforms.
* Achieve and maintain Department of Health Standards, holding your team accountable and role-modeling cleanliness and organization throughout the restaurant.
* Maintain cleanliness and organization of the restaurant
* Recruit, interview, hire, and retain a successful team. Train, coach, and mentor all team members
* Ensure completion of food safety checklists
* Maintain and manage food cost, troubleshooting any issues that may arise
* Handle daily P&L and financial responsibility- with special attention to waste and labor management and building top line sales to grow the business

**Benefits**

* Enrollment in Company-contributed health coverage plan, including dental and vision
* PTO starting at 15 days
* 401k with up to 4% match after ninety (90) days of employment
* Life insurance coverage fully paid by the Company
* Pre-tax commuter benefits
* Pet insurance
* Team member discounts at all our brands

**Qualifications**

* Minimum 3-5 years of General Manager experience in a restaurant with comparable steps of service and volume (Experience with full-service restaurants is required).
* Bachelor’s degree in Hospitality, Business, or related field preferred
* Formal culinary education is a plus
* Toast POS, Clover, or similar POS experience strongly preferred
* Previous experience with P&L, forecasting, inventory, and COGs is strongly preferred
* Strong critical thinking and problem-solving abilities required
* An entrepreneurial spirit. You are open to testing, iterating, learning, and testing some more to find the best business forward solutions
* The willingness to roll up your sleeves and pitch in whenever necessary
* The discipline and desire to create systems and organization within fast-changing environments
* Excellent communication skills and strong computer skills
* The ability to perform physical requirements of the position (lift up to 50lbs) with or without reasonable accommodation
* Your Department of Health and/or ServSafe certification
* Proficiency in Spanish, French, and/or Arabic a plus

*Convive Brands is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other protected class. Convive Brands celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.*

title: Housekeeper
description:
**ABOUT US:** - We believe that everyone deserves a home!
  
  

Breaking Ground operates nearly 4,000 units of housing across New York City, along with housing in upstate New York and Connecticut. Supportive housing - affordable housing paired with services designed to help people maintain their homes for the long-term - is widely recognized as a proven and cost-effective solution to chronic homelessness.
  
  

But we didn't stop at providing housing. Breaking Ground's programs and services help people experiencing street homelessness - especially those who have been on the streets the longest - to come indoors. Through our Street to Home outreach program and transitional housing resources, we help people get, and stay, on the path to a permanent home.
  
  

Williamsburg Safe Haven
  
  

Located in Brooklyn, the Williamsburg Safe Haven serves 78 individuals not yet ready to transition into permanent housing, as well as those who may have struggled in other housing programs. The Williamsburg Safe Haven offers an alternative to life on the street: private, safe, clean, and affordable short-term accommodations. On-site case management and clinical services are available to meet the needs of its residents and to help those ready to move into secure permanent housing.
  
  

Housekeeper –Transitional Housing
  
Reporting to the Facility Maintenance Supervisor, the Housekeeper is a part of the department that maintains the common areas of the safe haven. Examples of common areas include offices, multi-purpose rooms, roof deck, garden, trash collection area, lobby, fitness room and sidewalks. Client areas will also be cleaned.
  
This position has a 35-hour work week, onsite.
  
  

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITES:**  

* Sweep, mop, wash, dust, and vacuum
* Seal, wax, and buff floors and hard surfaces
* Maintain sidewalks, including sweeping, raking leaves, and shoveling snow
* Clean individual units when vacated or requested by work order
* Sort and package recyclables to comply with NYC regulations
* Operate compactor
* Set up and clean up for meetings and other events
* Assist painters and engineers when assigned
* Perform work at other facilities as required
* Perform other related duties as assigned


**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* Comparable work experience
* Experience operating of vacuum cleaner, high speed buffer
* Ability to lift and move furniture, appliances, etc.
* High School Diploma, GED, Trade School Diploma, or equivalent
* Ability to stand for several hours during shift and to climb stairs in the event of an emergency
* Experience working with special needs populations a plus
* Basic knowledge of using a computer is a plus, but is not required


EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled

title: Afternoon - Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
description:
**GBS is looking for a BCBA for a case in Montclair, NJ for 2-3 hours per week between the hours of 3:30pm-8pm on Mondays, Wednesdays, or Thursdays.**

* Conduct initial and concurrent assessments and develop individualized treatment plans every six months.
* Conduct Functional Behavior Assessments and develop Behavior Intervention Plans during the initial assessment or at the onset of problem behavior.
* Review treatment plans and behavior intervention plans with the client’s parent/caregiver before initiating.
* Conduct data analysis, update goals and objectives, data sheets, and bring instructional materials to the clients session weekly.
* Check Graham Behavior Services email address weekly.
* Train behavior therapists on skill acquisition programs and behavior intervention plans.
* Provide instructional materials needed for therapy.
* Schedule monthly clinics with family, therapists, and director as needed.
* Provide parents and caregivers with training on Applied Behavior Analysis.
* Assist caregivers with IEPs, evaluations by other service providers, understanding of autism, Applied Behavior Analysis, and special education.
* Coordinate care between school, home, and other service providers.
* Monitors children for signs of child abuse, and reports incidents of suspected abuse to appropriate personnel immediately.
* When possible provide direct services to clients if behavior therapist are unable.
* Inform Director of any problems or concerns with staff, clients, client’s family, and systems or procedures used by Graham Behavior Services.
* Assist Director in conducting annual evaluations of behavior therapists.
* Maintain open communication with parents and behavior therapists including scheduling home programming.
* Alert Director if scheduling problems arise that cannot be resolved.
* Supervise BCBA, BCaBa, and RBT candidates at BCBA’s discretion.
* Attends meetings, events, trainings, workshops, and seminars as required by Graham Behavior Services.
* Maintains advanced working knowledge of early childhood education and development practices and standards, and principles of applied behavioral analysis.
* Consistently demonstrates a high level of integrity, responsibility, accountability, teamwork and ethics.
* Adheres to all policies, procedures and standard practices of Graham Behavior Services.

**Job Summary:**

The Asset Management (AM) Supervisor will work alongside other key AM, Logistics, and National Operations members to assure incoming and outgoing shipments have the appropriate paperwork, are packaged, staged, and fulfilled accordingly. title: Bookkeeper Head Start; 5430-401-A
description:
For over 125 years, Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens has been providing quality social services to the neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens, and currently offers 160-plus programs and services for children, youth, adults, seniors, and those struggling with mental illness.
  
  

Our Early Childhood Development Centers provide free Early Head Start and Head Start services to low-income families. Head Start provides services to children age 3 to 5 years old. Through the Montessori approach, the center ensures children are ready for school by providing a variety of developmentally appropriate activities that promote cognitive, social, emotional, language-literacy and physical development.
  
  

**STATEMENT OF THE JOB:**  

Under the direct supervision of the Program Manager/Director, the Bookkeeper’s responsibilities include but not limited to prepare petty cash, submit check requests, track budget, on weekly basis prepare bank deposit slips/receipts, and disability insurance report.
  
  

* Maintains all records related to petty cash and the allocation of petty cash funds, including the replenishment of petty cash.
* Enters and maintains cash receipts and disbursement ledgers; summarizes as requested.
* Prepares and submits all requests for payments (check requests) in a timely and efficient manner.
* Prepares ACD-1 reports; End- Of- Month reports; disability insurance reports and all related forms/paperwork.
* Prepares all paperwork related to health insurance, retirement, and Welfare Fund reports for staff where applicable.
* Assists Management in the maintenance, ordering/purchasing and inventory of office supplies and other center-related items or supplies/equipment.
* Performs other duties as assigned.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* High School Diploma or Equivalent required.
* Associate degree or Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Business Administration, or Accounting preferred.
* Minimum of one year of experience as a full charge bookkeeper with proof of fiscal responsibilities.
* Bilingual Spanish/English; Russian/English; Chinese/English; Korean/English; English/Creole speaking preferred.
* Must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 30 pounds.
* Able to travel to multiple locations within the five boroughs as needed.


**BENEFITS:**  

**We offer competitive salary and excellent benefits including:**  

* Generous time off (Vacation/ Personal Days/ Sick Days/ Paid Holidays annually)
* Medical,
* Dental
* Vision
* Retirement Savings with Agency Match
* Transit
* Flexible Spending Account
* Life insurance
* Public Loan Forgiveness Qualified Employer
* Training Series and other additional voluntary benefits.


For more information on our organization, please visit our website at:
  
  

www.ccbq.org EOE/AA.

title: Assistant Teacher Head Start; 5435-208-N
description:
For over 125 years, Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens has been providing quality social services to the neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens, and currently offers 160-plus programs and services for children, youth, adults, seniors, and those struggling with mental illness.
  
  

Our Early Childhood Development Centers provide free Early Head Start and Head Start services to low-income families. Head Start provides services to children age 3 to 5 years old. Through the Montessori approach, the center ensures children are ready for school by providing a variety of developmentally appropriate activities that promote cognitive, social, emotional, language-literacy and physical development.
  
  

**STATEMENT OF THE JOB:**  

The Head Start (HS) Assistant Teacher will assist the Teacher to plan and execute age and developmentally appropriate activities reflecting the Montessori curriculum. Responsibilities include but are not limited to assist the Teacher to maintain the written documentation/reports in order to meet compliance standards of CCNS, ACS, DOH, CACFP, and other overseeing agencies relevant to NYFD; help to facilitate parent involvement in all aspects of the program and promote positive growth and professional development. The candidate will adhere to policies and procedures established by CCNS, ACS, DOH, DOE, and CACFP and comply with procedural norms and standards of attendance, punctuality, and confidentiality relevant to HIPPA.
  
* Ensures a learning environment based on the Montessori approach that helps the children develop, physically, emotionally, socially, cognitively, and creatively.
* Complete written observations, progress reports, outcomes reporting, CROWD, and other documents relevant to the tracking of children’s progress.
* Establishes and maintains positive relationships with parents/families via open communications, training and other developmental activities.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* Minimum of a 30 college credits required.
* Associate Degree in Early Childhood Education or 60 credits including 24 credits in Education preferred; or BA or Bachelors degree with 24 credits in education preferred.
* CDA preferred.
* 2 years of teaching experience in a preschool classroom preferred.
* If not already obtained CDA or 24 credits in Education or Early Childhood Education, must commit to complete CDC training program within the first year of hire.
* Montessori trained or must commit to enroll in the Agency’s Montessori training program within the first year of hire and complete the training as required.
* Bilingual Spanish/English; Russian/English; Chinese/English; Korean/English; English/Creole speaking preferred.
