title: Marketing Coordinator & SEO specialist
description:
**Position: Marketing Coordinator & SEO Specialist**

**Overview:** We are seeking a highly skilled and organized Marketing Coordinator & Website Designer to enhance and maintain our brand across all media channels. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in SEO, digital marketing, website design, content creation, and project management. This role involves collaborating with cross-functional teams, creating strategic marketing plans, and generating new business opportunities. The candidate should be able to manage SEO strategies, improve website design, and drive to field locations for content creation using the company car.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Brand Development:** Assist in creating, maintaining, and strengthening the organization’s brand presence across platforms (Google My Business, PPC, landing pages, social media, etc.).
* **Field Content Creation:** Drive to field locations with workers to create authentic content, including capturing videos and photos from technicians. Actively seek out relevant content in our specific field.
* **Strategic Marketing:** Support the development and execution of marketing plans aimed at generating new business opportunities.
* **CRM Management:** Find and manage the CRM marketing platform. Collaborate with team members to review weekly reports and suggest improvements.
* **SEO Strategy & Optimization:** Conduct keyword research, set SEO campaigns, optimize website elements, and perform regular audits to ensure SEO best practices. Develop off-page strategies to build brand authority.
* **Website Design & Development:** Redesign and develop mobile-responsive websites that align with the company’s brand. Collaborate with content creators and developers to ensure websites are optimized for both aesthetics and functionality.
* **Design & Marketing Materials:** Manage redesigns for websites, business cards, in-store materials, car marketing, uniforms, email marketing materials, etc.
* **Event & Promotion Support:** Help create and execute events and promotions aimed at increasing traffic to stores, focusing on delivering great value for money.
* **Brand Promotion:** Push the brand through various media outlets, including magazines, PR campaigns, and social media influencers.
* **Project Management:** Manage website projects from start to finish, collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure successful execution.

**Qualifications:**

* **Marketing & Brand Development:** At least 2 years of experience in a marketing coordinator role or similar position, with proven skills in building and maintaining a brand presence.
* **Website Design:** At least 2 years of experience in website design and development, with a strong portfolio of visually appealing, mobile-responsive websites.
* **Content Creation & Field Work:** Experience in video and photo production with the ability to drive to field locations.
* **Strategic Marketing & CRM:** Strong experience supporting strategic marketing plans and managing CRM platforms. Ability to interpret reports and suggest improvements.
* **SEO Expertise:** At least 2 years of experience in SEO, with a proven track record of improving search rankings. Proficient in SEO tools like Google Analytics, SEMRush, Moz, and Google Search Console.
* **Design & Marketing Materials:** Experience managing the redesign of websites and marketing materials with strong attention to both print and digital assets.
* **Event Management & Promotions:** Experience planning and executing events and promotions, driving traffic to physical locations.
* **Communication & Project Management:** Excellent project management skills, with the ability to manage website projects from start to finish.
* **Technical Knowledge:** Familiarity with content management systems such as WordPress or Drupal, with the ability to produce and manage web content independently.
* **Self-Motivation & Time Management:** Highly self-motivated, with strong organizational and time management skills to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* **Driver's License:** Valid driver's license and ability to drive the company car to field locations for content creation.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Experience:

* Web design: 1 year (Required)
* Marketing: 1 year (Required)
* SEO tools: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Hoboken, NJ 07030: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Media Planner, Strategy
description:
**Company Description**  

Publicis Media harnesses the power of modern media through global agency brands Publicis Collective, Spark Foundry, Starcom and Zenith. A key business solution of Publicis Groupe, Publicis Media’s digital-first, data-driven global practices deliver client value and drive growth in a platform-powered world. It is present in more than sixty countries with over 23,000 employees worldwide.

 **Job Description** **Overview****:**


Prepare and implement media plans for client accounts across all types of media.

**Responsibilities****:**

* Provide research for and write media Point-Of-Views (POVs). Assess various variables including, but not restricted to: circulation, audience information, scale, penetration, and product or service usage.
* Develop media strategy and recommendations under supervisor guidance.
* Present media plans and provide plan maintenance including objectives/strategies and updates.
* Maintain stewardship of reports including competitive reports using “Kantar” software to assess media schedules of competitors. Be capable of interpreting competitive data and relaying conclusions.
* Prepare flowcharts and budgets for media plan using Excel, PowerPoint, and planning-specific software.
* Prepare and issue buying specs and guidelines to buyers including GRP goals and budgets for use in negotiations.
* Review and verify media buys to ensure proper execution.
* Meet with sales reps to analyze value and applicability of media vehicles for client media plan.
* Liaise with internal Strategic Resources department for use of syndicated resources.
* Be willing to participate in more advanced functions as part of training and development.
* Resolve routine, but complex questions and problems.
* Demonstrate independent decision making.
* Be capable of some personnel evaluation.
* May perform other duties and responsibilities that management may deem necessary from time to time.

 **Qualifications**  

Bachelor’s degree


1+ year’s media planning experience (agency environment) across all types of media

**Business Competencies:**

* Computer Skills: Microsoft Suite, Kantar Software, IMS, Software Skills, Flowchart Software, Comscore
* Proficiency in oral and written communications
* Understanding of Activation/Negotiation team functions
* Possess a basic knowledge of strengths and weaknesses of each media type.
* Able to make independent decisions

  

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Compensation Range: $60,000 - $62,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 9/23/2024.

description:

title: Director of Clinical Support
description:
### **Join the future of dentistry, led by dentists**



At Dental365, we're reshaping the way patients experience dental care. By placing patients and providers at the core of our approach, we're breaking new ground in the world of dentistry. Since our inception in 2014, we've touched the lives of hundreds of thousands of patients and have emerged as a leading and distinguished dental organization, led by dentists. If you're a motivated change-maker looking to build a lifelong career in dentistry – now is the time to take part in our journey.


**Please Note: This position is not remote. Flexible on designated headquarters location within our territories.**

  


### **OUR POSITION:**


Our team is looking to bring on an experienced, hands-on, **Director of Clinical Support** to help develop and oversee our doctor concierge services and interdisciplinary projects across all departments. This role reports to our Chief Operating Officer and is supported by our President. This vital role helps ensure our clinicians feel supported throughout the entire employee lifecycle.

The Director of Clinical Support must understand be a self-starter and be able to work with all department leaders to ensure positive employee engagement and successful completion of various projects.
Qualified candidates will have a demonstrated career history in healthcare management, and training. Candidates with experience across multi-site dental groups are highly preferred.
### **RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* **Doctor Engagement:** Lead the process of doctor engagement, ensuring smooth onboarding and continuous support for all doctors.
* **Team Coordination:** Manage and coordinate the office support team, which includes Regional CSD (Dentists), Hygiene Executive team members (Hygienist), Operations VP, Regional Manager, RCM, Facilities, Talent, and our Back Office Trainers.
* **Liaison Role:** Act as the primary liaison between clinical and non-clinical personnel, understanding each team member's role and creating a comprehensive reporting structure.
* **Reporting and Action Items:** Generate actionable items and concise reports for the executive team. Follow up on action items with department leads to ensure completion.
### **YOUR EXPERIENCE:**


* Minimum of 5+ years of relevant work experience in healthcare or dental setting.
* Prior experience working with clinicals.
* Experience in project management.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Proven ability to build rapport with colleagues and train staff.
* Highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

### **OUR EMPLOYEE BENEFITS!**


* **Flexible Health and Vision Insurance Plans**: Tailored options for you and your family's well-being.
* **401(K) Retirement Plan with Matching:** Secure your financial future with our **employer-matched plan up to 6%.**
* **Generous Paid-Time Off**: Accrue up to 3 weeks, plus an annual "you" day for self-care.
* **Exclusive In-house Dental Program**: Heavily discounted services for you and your immediate family.
* **Extra Perks and Fringe Benefits**: Enjoy additional benefits and ongoing perks for our dedicated teams.
* Incredible work environment of skilled individuals with the opportunity for massive growth!
* *All benefits available at full-time employment (30+ hours weekly). Some benefits available for part-time employees as well.*


*New York Salary Range: $100,000 - $150,000*



### **Step into a new era with Dental365**


**A modern practice environment designed for superior care and comfort.** We embrace cutting-edge technology in a soothing environment that goes beyond your ordinary dental practice. We've thought through every step in the patient's experience to perfect our communication and care so that each visit is an eagerly anticipated event.


**We're a team that supports your success.** Emphasizing health over sales, we cultivate a warm, supportive culture without the pressure of production quotas. Those motivated for growth in their career are encouraged and supported to reach their full potential.


**Dental365 celebrates diversity.** Our company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression in terms of all conditions of employment. Our diversity is one of our greatest strengths, and as an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to promote a work environment where all differences are respected.

title: AR/AP Manager
description:
\\*\\*Job Summary:\\*\\* We are seeking an experienced and skilled Accounts Receivable Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing the day-to-day operations of accounts receivable, ensuring timely and accurate billing and collection of payments. The successful applicant will possess a strong understanding of financial concepts, accounting software, and medical terminology. This role is essential to the financial health of the organization and requires an individual who is detail-oriented, organized, and able to work effectively with internal and external stakeholders. \\*\\*Duties:\\*\\* - Manage and maintain accurate and up-to-date records of accounts receivable, including patient accounts and insurance claims. - Conduct regular account reconciliations to ensure that all accounts are accurately reflected on the financial statements. - Prepare and process invoices and billing statements in accordance with established policies and procedures. - Follow up with patients and insurance companies to resolve billing discrepancies and collect outstanding payments. - Coordinate with the patient billing team to ensure timely and accurate billing of patient accounts. - Develop and maintain effective communication strategies to improve patient satisfaction and reduce billing-related complaints. - Collaborate with internal departments to resolve billing-related issues and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements. - Analyze and interpret financial data to identify trends and areas for improvement. - Implement process improvements to increase efficiency and reduce costs. - Stay up-to-date with industry developments and regulatory changes, ensuring compliance with relevant laws and regulations. \\*\\*Experience:\\*\\* - Bachelor's degree in Accounting or a related field. - Minimum of 3 years of experience in an accounts receivable role, preferably in a healthcare or medical setting. - Experience with accounting software such as Sage and a strong understanding of financial concepts. - Familiarity with medical terminology and ICD-10 coding. - Proven experience with public accounting and/or telemarketing. - Strong organizational and analytical skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with patients, insurance companies, and internal stakeholders. - Certification as a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or Certified Medical Coder (CMC) is preferred.

title: Quant Developer - Associate / Assistant Vice President
description:
iCapital is powering the world's alternative investment marketplace. Our financial technology platform has transformed how advisors, wealth management firms, asset managers, and banks evaluate and recommend bespoke public and private market strategies for their high-net-worth clients. iCapital services approximately $187 billion in global client assets invested in 1,504 funds, as of April 2024.

  



iCapital has been named to the Forbes Fintech 50 for seven consecutive years (2018-2024); a three-time selection by Forbes to its list of Best Startup Employers (2021-2023); and a three-time winner of MMI/Barron's Solutions Provider award (See link below).

  


**About the Role**



The Quant team's goal is to deliver industry-leading analytical insights that help financial advisors and investors managing their multi-asset portfolios and utilizing alternative assets to meet their long-term investment objects. The team consists of Quantitative Researchers and Quantitative Developers to research, define, and implement models that will guide clients in portfolio construction, asset allocation, and risk management. The team members have diverse backgrounds such as math, physics, economics, quantitative finance, computer science, and other science and engineering fields, and collaborate closely with business-side colleagues, platform architects, software developers, and product managers to deliver analytics through the software platform for the firm's clients.



The Quant Developers have a core mission of developing robust and scalable quantitative models to deliver portfolio risk analytics capabilities as part of the firm's commercial technology platform for financial advisors and asset managers. The team members will implement statistical, machine learning, and quantitative financial models, applied to a combination of proprietary, public, and third-party data, to deliver analytics for multi-asset portfolios including alternative assets such as hedge fund, private equity, private credit, real estate, and digital assets.


**Responsibilities**


* Develop robust and scalable quantitative financial models and collaborate closely with quant researchers to productionize proprietary risk analytics models as part of the firm's software platform
* Develop centralized financial calculation engines powering the firm's commercial technology platform
* Document and communicate quantitative methodologies and analytics to others including stakeholders and clients
* Collaborate with other teams to ensure risk analytics are delivered through the software platform with excellent user experience


**Qualifications**


* 4+ year of professional experience in quantitative financial modeling, data science, or software development
* Expertise in implementing statistical analysis, machine learning, or financial modeling with Python, and proficiency in full-stack software development
* Ability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
* Knowledge of JAVA/Scala/C++ is a plus
* Experience with AWS is a plus

  



The base salary range for this role is $120,000 to $170,000 depending on level. iCapital offers a compensation package which includes salary, equity for all full-time employees, and an annual performance bonus. Employees also receive a comprehensive benefits package that includes an employer matched retirement plan, generously subsidized healthcare with 100% employer paid dental, vision, telemedicine, and virtual mental health counseling, parental leave, and unlimited paid time off (PTO).



We believe the best ideas and innovation happen when we are together. Employees in this role will work in the office three days, with the flexibility to work remotely two days. Every department has different needs, and some positions will be designated in-office jobs, based on their function.



.



For additional information on iCapital, please visit https://www.icapitalnetwork.com/about-us Twitter: @icapitalnetwork | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/icapital-network-inc | Awards Disclaimer: https://www.icapitalnetwork.com/about-us/recognition/

  



iCapital is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Knowledge Manager
description:
### **Where You'll Come In**



As the Knowledge Manager, you play an integral part in the impact of the overall CX L&D strategy at The Farmer's Dog. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Learning & Development, you own, execute, and innovate the knowledge base (KB) strategy to ensure our associates have the tools and knowledge to facilitate a world-class customer experience. You make strategic decisions on how to overhaul our knowledge base content, own the maintenance and innovation strategy, foster the cross-functional partnerships that make our knowledge base thrive, and do it all with excellent change management communications. Our goal is for any associate to find the answer to their question in under 30 seconds, and you directly support that goal, and bring it to life!


### **How You'll Make An Impact**


* Define and implement knowledge management strategy for our knowledge base and maintain high quality, up-to-date, and searchable content for audiences of varying skill levels
* Lead the implementation of Guru, our knowledge platform, to ensure it is set up for success and operation optimally
* Lead the overhauling of our knowledge base content based on our help documentation style guide, and manage the migration of our content from its current platform to Guru
* Work cross functionally to implement a strategy to ensure content is accurate and aligned with stakeholder insight
* Implement a Knowledge Centered Service (KCS) workflow to ensure the speed of maintaining content is a top priority
* Monitor the effectiveness of our knowledge base and make continuous improvements based on feedback, data, and emerging best practices
* Own reporting and communications around our knowledge base the highlight the return on investment of our knowledge base
* Ensure knowledge management practices are inspired by good change management practices, and use this knowledge to impact other areas of the business
* Implement and improve a defined strategy for the relationship between our knowledge base and our "Answers" (templates) in our ticketing system
* Identify and implement world class strategies to innovate and improve the efficacy of our knowledge base
* Define our writing style to better support the use of AI search tools
* Manage and upskill a team of Content Writers who own the day to day maintenance of our knowledge base, and jump in to help whenever needed
* Stay updated on industry trends and technological advancements in knowledge management

### **We're Excited About You Because**


* Have a deep understanding of good knowledge management
* Have experience writing for a customer experience organization
* Have refined writing and self-editing skills
* Have experience optimizing writing for an AI support tool
* Have world-class communication and leadership skills
* Are able to thrive in ambiguous situations & find clarity
* Have a keen eye for ways to innovate and improve
* Have excellent project and time management skills; ability to handle multiple projects concurrently
* Are an expert in creative problem-solving
* Are detail-oriented and thorough
* Have experience with Guru, Asana, and/or Gladly
* Have 4+ years of experience in a knowledge base or content role
* Have 2+ years of experience owning a knowledge base and leading a team of content writers
* Are KCS v6 certified
* Willing to travel domestically


We commit to building a competitive compensation package and company environment for all individuals to thrive. We believe in competitive base compensation rooted in location specific market data and performance along with equity ownership in the company that allows every team member to build their personal wealth as the company grows, just as much as we believe in fostering a culture that supports our team members personally, professionally, and holistically. **For this role the anticipated hiring base compensation range is $110,000 - $120,000 USD Annual and the compensation offered will include a robust market competitive package of base and equity.** In addition to your base compensation offer you will also receive equity ownership in the company. More information about the value of this equity will be shared at the time of offer. This range is representative of NYC Market Data if you are applying to this role outside of the NYC area the range may change.

------------------------------------------

title: Logins Processor
description:
A leader in the alternative finance industry based in Cedarhurst, NY, committed to providing innovative funding solutions to small and medium-sized businesses is looking for an organized, efficient Logins Processor to join their team! The Logins Processor is responsible for managing and optimizing daily operations processes within our funding business. This role involves processing login requests, handling funding calls, data entry, and monitoring deal flow. The ideal candidate will have exceptional attention to detail, strong communication skills, and the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently while ensuring the security and accessibility of user accounts.


Responsibilities:
* **Daily Operations:** Execute and manage daily operational processes, ensuring tasks are completed accurately and on time.
* **Login and Funding Calls:** Field and manage login and funding calls, providing accurate information and resolving any issues that arise.
* **Data Entry:** Accurately enter and update data related to cash advances in company systems, ensuring data integrity and confidentiality.
* **Deal Flow Monitoring:** Monitor and track deal flow, ensuring all transactions are processed correctly and efficiently.
* **Compliance:** Ensure all processes comply with relevant regulatory requirements and company policies.
* **Documentation:** Maintain detailed documentation of processes, including standard operating procedures (SOPs) and daily logs.
* **Reporting:** Generate daily and weekly reports on operations performance, highlighting key metrics and any areas of concern.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with the sales, finance, and customer service teams to ensure seamless processing and to address any issues promptly.
* **Problem Solving:** Identify and resolve operational and login-related issues, developing and implementing corrective actions as needed.
* **Continuous Improvement** : Propose and implement improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy in processing and login management.
* **Other Duties as Assigned** : Perform additional tasks as required to support the team and business operations.

Qualifications:


* **Education** : High school diploma or equivalent. An associate’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Information Technology, or a related field is a plus.
* **Experience** : Minimum of 1 year of experience in a similar role within the financial services or cash advance industry.
* **Technical Skills** : Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Experience with financial software, CRM systems, and login management tools.
* **Attention to Detail** : Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy in all aspects of work.
* **Communication Skills:** Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to handle internal calls professionally and effectively.
* **Organizational Skills:** Strong organizational and time-management skills. Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously.
* **Team Player:** Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
* **Problem-Solving Skills:** Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to develop and implement effective solutions.

title: Funding Coordinator
description:
A financial services company, based out of Cedarhurst that is committed to providing their clients with superior financial solutions and have built their reputation on innovation and dynamism is looking for an organized, efficient Funding Coordinator to join their team! The Funding Coordinator plays a crucial role in ensuring the smooth execution of funding processes and internal operations. This role involves login processing, team coordination, overseeing and coordinating communications, and performing various administrative tasks. The ideal candidate will have strong organizational skills, excellent communication abilities, and a keen attention to detail, ensuring that all funding activities are executed accurately and efficiently.


Responsibilities:
* **Login Processing:** Manage and process login requests, ensuring secure and timely access for team members and stakeholders.
* **Team Coordination:** Coordinate with various departments to ensure seamless communication and collaboration on funding processes and other operational tasks.
* **Communications Oversight:** Oversee and coordinate internal communications to the various departments, ensuring all relevant information is disseminated efficiently and effectively.
* **Administrative Tasks:** Perform a variety of administrative tasks including data entry, document management, scheduling, and maintaining records related to funding activities.
* **Operational Support:** Assist in the daily operations of the funding department, ensuring all processes are followed and tasks are completed on time.
* **Monitoring and Reporting:** Monitor the progress of funding processes and generate reports to keep the team informed of key metrics and any issues that arise.
* **Process Improvement:** Propose and implement improvements to streamline processes and enhance operational efficiency.
* **Other Duties as Assigned:** Perform additional tasks as required to support the team and ensure smooth business operations.

Qualifications:
* **Education:** High school diploma or equivalent; an associate’s or bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, or a related field is preferred.
* **Experience:** Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in a similar role, preferably in the financial services or cash advance.
* **Technical Skills:** Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Experience with CRM systems and financial software is a plus.
* **Communication Skills:** Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey information clearly and effectively.
* **Organizational Skills:** Strong organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously.
* **Team Player:** Ability to work collaboratively with different teams, fostering a cooperative and productive work environment.
* **Problem-Solving Skills:** Strong problem-solving abilities, with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing issues.
* **Attention to Detail:** High attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and completeness in all tasks.

title: Junior Underwriter
description:
A financial services company, based out of Cedarhurst that is committed to providing their clients with superior financial solutions and have built their reputation on innovation and dynamism is seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Junior Underwriter to join their team! The Junior Underwriter plays a key role in supporting the underwriting process by evaluating the creditworthiness of businesses applying for funding. This position involves reviewing financial statements, assessing risk, and working closely with senior underwriters to make informed decisions. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, analytical, and eager to learn the intricacies of underwriting in the cash advance industry.


**Responsibilities:**

* **Merchant Cash Advance (MCA) Underwriting:** Assist in evaluating MCA applications by analyzing financial statements, credit reports, and other relevant data to assess the creditworthiness of potential clients.
* **Risk Assessment:** Support senior underwriters in identifying potential risks associated with funding applications and help determine appropriate funding terms.
* **Collaboration with Junior Underwriters:** Work closely with other junior underwriters to ensure consistency in the underwriting process and to share insights and best practices.
* **Documentation Review:** Review and verify the accuracy and completeness of documentation provided by applicants, ensuring all necessary information is obtained for the underwriting process.
* **Data Entry:** Accurately enter and update client information and financial data in the underwriting system.
* **Communication:** Communicate with clients, brokers, and internal teams to gather additional information and clarify any discrepancies in applications.
* **Report Preparation:** Assist in preparing underwriting reports and summaries for review by senior underwriters and management.
* **Compliance:** Ensure all underwriting processes adhere to company policies and relevant regulatory requirements.
* **Continuous Learning:** Stay up-to-date with industry trends, underwriting guidelines, and best practices to enhance underwriting skills and knowledge.
* **Support Senior Underwriters:** Provide general support to senior underwriters in managing their portfolios and processing funding applications.
* **Other Duties as Assigned:** Perform additional tasks as required to support the underwriting team and overall business objectives.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or a related field.
* **Experience:** 1-2 years of experience in Merchant Cash Advance (MCA) underwriting or a related financial services role.
* **Technical Skills:** Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Familiarity with underwriting software and financial analysis tools is a plus.
* **Analytical Skills:** Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret financial data and assess risk accurately.
* **Attention to Detail:** Exceptional attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and thoroughness in all tasks.
* **Communication Skills:** Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to interact professionally with clients and team members.
* **Organizational Skills:** Strong organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to handle multiple tasks and deadlines.
* **Team Collaboration:** Ability to work collaboratively with other junior underwriters and contribute to a team-oriented environment.
* **Willingness to Learn:** Eagerness to learn and develop skills in underwriting and credit analysis.

title: Assistant Teacher
description:
**Assistant Teacher**

Family Services of Westchester (FSW) provides mental health and social services that strengthen and support families, children and individuals at every stage of their lives. With 50 innovative programs, FSW serves 30,000 individuals annually in Westchester County, New York, here to create hope, restore dignity and connect families with the resources to get back on track.

Founded in 1954, Family Services of Westchester is a private, nonprofit, non-sectarian social services agency.

FSW’s Head Start/Early Head Start is a federal government program that was created in 1965 to give preschool children from low-income families a “head start” on their readiness for elementary school.

**\\*\\*Effective May 1st, 2024 – May 31st, 2024, we will be offering a sign on bonus of $1,000 to all Lead Teachers and $500 to all Assistant Teachers who apply within the specified window of time.**

**This sign on bonus will align with FSW’s outlined procedure, as well as be agreed upon between both the applicant and HR upon time of hire.\\*\\***

**Job Details:**

Family Services of Westchester is looking for **full-time Assistant Teachers** for our **Head Start** program. We are hiring for multiple locations throughout Westchester County.

**POSITION TITLE**: Assistant Teacher  
**SALARY:** *$16.75/hour*  
**STATUS**: Permanent/Full Time  
**SUPERVISED BY**: Head Teacher  
**PURPOSE**: To assist and support the Head Teacher to interpret and implement the Head Start & Early Head Start programs to address the needs of each individual child.  
**WORK LOCATION:** One Location

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES**:

* Ensure health and safety guidelines for children.
* Assist lead teacher in the documentation, reflection and planning process to implement the curriculum.
* Attend staff training to support professional development.
* Build relationships with families and communicate about children's learning and development.
* Assist with creating a warm and inclusive environment for children and families.
* Assist with creating visual evidence of the narratives and curriculum occurring in your classroom.
* Other tasks as assigned by supervisor and Head Teacher.

**MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS**:

* CDA or Associate’s Degree in Early Childhood Education or related field, English fluency.

**PERFORMANCE CRITERIA**: Performance will be evaluated based on:

* Continuing to pursue education in the Early Childhood field.
* Performance and Goals
* Seniority.

**Ability to Commute/Relocate:**

* White Plains, NY 10603: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

**Experience**:

* Childcare: 1 year (Preferred)

**Bonus opportunities for eligible Lead Teachers and Assistant Teachers, based on performance and employment status.**

There are a variety of benefits to joining Family Services of Westchester, an organization with over 65 years of history impacting vulnerable communities. In addition to the opportunity to connect with and help thousands of residents in Westchester County, FSW offers its employees an inspiring, diverse and team-based work environment with comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, life insurance, flexible spending accounts, and 403(b) for full-time employees.

At FSW, we enjoy working in a collaborative, mission-driven environment and value the benefits of a diversified workplace that prioritizes our clients and the communities we serve. If you want to make a difference in the lives of thousands of people across the communities of Westchester, and if the position of Assistant Teacher speaks to your capabilities, experience and commitment to social service, please submit your resume and cover letter. Qualified candidates will be contacted by phone and/or email.

*FSW is an equal opportunity employer.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $16.75 - $17.28 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person
company_description: FSW is a nonprofit organization providing Westchester County with a vast range of social and mental health services that strengthen and support individuals at every stage of the life cycle.

title: Social Worker
description:
**Social Worker**  
*Join Our Team at Queens Nassau Rehabilitation and Nursing Center*

**Reports to**: Director of Social Services  
**Location**: Queens Nassau Rehabilitation and Nursing Center

Are you passionate about making a real difference in the lives of others? Do you have a deep commitment to enhancing the quality of life for those in need? Queens Nassau Rehabilitation and Nursing Center is looking for a dedicated and compassionate **Social Worker** to be part of our interdisciplinary team, providing vital support to residents and their families.

At our center, we focus on holistic care, promoting well-being, dignity, and quality of life for every individual we serve. If you are an advocate for positive change and have the expertise and heart for social work, we’d love to meet you!

**Why You’ll Love Working With Us**

* **Impactful Work**: Be the voice for residents, ensuring their emotional, social, and psychological needs are met.
* **Collaborative Environment**: Work alongside an experienced and supportive team committed to exceptional resident care.
* **Professional Growth**: We offer opportunities for ongoing professional development to help you grow in your role.
* **Competitive Benefits**: Full-time benefits, including health, dental, and retirement packages.

**What You’ll Do**

* **Personalized Resident Care**: Manage a caseload of 80 residents, ensuring personalized social and emotional support.
* **Care Planning**: Develop and implement comprehensive care plans through your knowledge of the Minimum Data Set (MDS) and care planning process.
* **Facilitate Smooth Transitions**: Guide residents and their families through discharge planning, ensuring safe and smooth transitions back to the community or other care settings.
* **Family & Team Collaboration**: Lead weekly family and interdisciplinary team meetings to discuss progress, address concerns, and make care recommendations.
* **Charting & Documentation**: Maintain accurate and timely records of resident interactions, care plans, and progress notes.
* **Resource Advocacy**: Connect residents with community resources and services that enhance their well-being.

**Who You Are**

* **Empathetic**: You’re a natural at building trust and fostering meaningful relationships with residents, families, and colleagues.
* **Experienced**: You have proven experience as a social worker and are always seeking ways to further your knowledge.
* **Knowledgeable**: You have a strong understanding of social theories and clinical practices and know how to apply them to real-world situations.
* **Resilient**: You excel in handling complex situations and advocating for those in need, even in challenging circumstances.
* **Team-Oriented**: You thrive in collaborative settings, working closely with interdisciplinary teams.
* **Educational Requirements**: You hold a BSW or MSW from an accredited program.

**Job Details**

* **Job Type**: Full-time (Monday - Friday, 9 AM - 5 PM)
* **Special Focus**: Traumatic brain injury and geriatric care

**Ready to Make a Difference?**

If you’re driven by compassion and want to make a real impact, we encourage you to apply. Be a part of a team that values your dedication and experience, and join us in enhancing the lives of our residents.

title: Director, Payroll
description:
**Who is Nexxen?**  

One platform. Endless opportunities. In an ecosystem where everyone's trying to get closer – buyers to sellers, platforms to clients, brands to consumers – Nexxen bridges new opportunities in ways that others cannot. Data, service, and planning capabilities are our superpowers, enabling our clients to better reach and understand audiences across screens. Nexxen brings new and distinct opportunities to our partners, giving our employees the chance to expand and grow their skills.


**Why join the Nexxen team?**  

With a global footprint, you can be part of a team that is transforming advertising through our creative, flexible and unified solutions. Employees hustle, commit and dedicate themselves to pillars that make up the Nexxen Way – the 3Cs - Customer Centric, Curious Mindset, Collaborative with No Ego.


**What you'll do:**



The Director, Payroll oversees all aspects of the global payroll function, ensuring accurate and timely payroll processing for all employees. This role leads the payroll team, implements and maintains payroll systems and ensures compliance with country, federal, state and local regulations. The Director, Payroll works closely with various departments to ensure payroll is integrated with other business processes and systems effectively.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Lead and manage the payroll department, including hiring, training, and evaluating staff performance.
* Develop and implement payroll policies, procedures, and systems that align with company goals and regulatory requirements.
* Provide guidance and support to payroll team members to ensure high performance and professional development.
* Oversee the accurate and timely processing of global payrolls, including regular, bonus, and incentive payments.
* Ensure proper tax withholding, wage and hour compliance, and adherence to all payroll-related regulations.
* Manage payroll operations, including payroll accounting, audits, reconciliations, and reporting.
* Oversee the implementation and management of payroll vendors.
* Ensure payroll systems are updated in response to changes in laws and regulations.
* Collaborate with IT and HR teams to integrate payroll with other business systems (HRIS, Time & Attendance, etc.).
* Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local payroll laws and regulations, including tax filings and reporting.
* Manage internal and external payroll audits and respond to inquiries from regulatory agencies.
* Monitor and ensure compliance with wage and hour laws, including overtime, minimum wage, and pay equity requirements.
* Prepare and present payroll-related financial reports to senior management.
* Analyze payroll data to identify trends, issues, and opportunities for efficiency and cost savings.
* Work closely with HR, Finance, Legal, and other departments to ensure payroll is aligned with overall business objectives.
* Provide expertise on payroll matters in relation to compensation planning and organizational changes.


**Qualifications:**


**Education:**


* Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Human Resources, or a related field.


**Experience:**


* Minimum of 7 years of experience in payroll management, with at least 3 years in a leadership role.
* Extensive knowledge of payroll systems (e.g., ADP, Workday, SAP) and payroll-related regulations.
* Experience with multi-state and international payroll.


**Skills:**


* Strong leadership and team management skills.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.
* Proficient in payroll software and Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel.
* Strong understanding of federal, state, and local payroll regulations.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.


**Certifications:**


* Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) designation preferred.

  



In support of pay transparency and equity, the minimum and maximum full-time annual base salary for this role in New York, Chicago or Los Angeles is $125,000 - $150,000 at the time of posting, with the potential of an incentive or bonus. While this is our reasonable expectation this is not a guarantee of compensation or salary, actual compensation is influenced by a wide range of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, education, certifications, responsibility, and geographic location. Candidates hired to work in other locations will be subject to the pay range associated with that location. We offer a variety of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability insurance, 401(k), EAP, parental leave, unlimited vacation, and company-paid holidays. The specific programs and options available will vary depending on the state, start date, and employment type. Our Talent Acquisition team will be happy to answer any questions you may have.

title: Tax Supervisor

**Essential Job functions:**

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
**Overview:**


We seek passionate, driven, self-motivated, creative thinkers and sales hunters who thrive in fast-paced, energetic environments. As a Sales Development Representative (SDR) for Fuel Cycle, you will play a key role in outbound prospecting and building sales pipelines. You will be responsible for conducting exploratory conversations with prospects and building rapport within the market research communities. If you enjoy building relationships, you will find a fantastic opportunity with Fuel Cycle.


Join a growing, industry leading team of customer obsessed individuals that empower each other to work passionately and deliver impact; A place where personal and professional growth is a priority!


Fuel Cycle is regularly recognized as a great place to work. Our recent awards include 2024 Built In Best Places to Work, 2023 Inc Best Workplaces, as well as Comparably Best CEO, Best Company for Women, and Best Company for Diversity. Learn more about our Culture & Values here.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Source new business sales opportunities (beginning with the discovery call booking) through strategic outbound cold calls, social and email
* Manage inbound Leads from marketing programs within SLA’s (Inbound about 20% of activity)
* Knowledge of sales tools such as SFDC, Outreach, Seamless, 6Sense, Dripify, LinkedIn Sales Nav (or Similar tools)
* Research accounts, identify key players, outbound prospect to generate interest
* Team with Enterprise Sales Directors (ESDs) to build pipeline
* Maintain database of prospects in assigned territory within CRM
* Listen to, interview prospective customers, and effectively communicate their needs and requirements
* Map prospective accounts around organizational structure, people, and existing technology
* Develop qualified sales opportunities and set qualified discovery meetings for ESD counterparts that will lead to demos and generation of active pipeline

**Your Success Metrics:**

* Achieve monthly quotas of qualified discovery meetings, demos, and pipeline generation
* Monthly KPIs: 5 Discovery Meetings Held, 3 Demo Meetings Held & Generation of New Pipeline Generated (as a result of SDR booked Discovery Meetings)
* Conduct 50+ outbound calls/day to targeted prospects and cold/warm leads

 **Who you’ll work with?**

* Work closely with other SDRs, Enterprise Sales Directors, Sales Ops, and Marketing to implement appropriate prospect communications and outreach strategies

 **Core Skills, Competencies & Attributes:**

* Effective Communicator
* Proficient in Lead Generation & Initial Qualification
* Problem-Solver
* Highly Adaptable
* Strong Time Management

 **What you’ll bring:**

* 1 - 2 years of SDR or progressive outbound sales experience, software, research or enterprise sales a plus
* Passion for technology and a technical aptitude to master sales stack tools
* Excellent written and oral communication
* A keenly developed competitive nature
* Experience with Salesforce or a similar CRM a plus
* A winning and self-starter attitude
* Preferred, but Not Required: BA/BS preferred or equivalent experience.

 **Benefits:**

* Health/Dental/Vision Insurance
* 401k match
* Flexible Work Schedule
* 15 Vacation Days + 7 Sick Days annually
* 11 Holidays + 4 Synchronized Recharge Days
* Parental Leave
* Monthly Internet/Phone Stipend
* All Team Perks: many including: DoorDash, GymPass, Headspace & more
* LA & NY HQ Perks: Free lunches, refreshments & snacks
* Pet Friendly HQs


This position pays between $60,000-$65,000 base salary + commission & equity. Your final base salary will be determined based on location, work experience, skills, knowledge, education and/or certifications.


If you are located within a 25-mile radius of our LA or NY HQs, you will be considered a hybrid associate and will be required to be in the office 3 days/week.

**About Fuel Cycle**:


Fuel Cycle accelerates decision intelligence for legendary brands. We achieve this by enabling organizations to capture, analyze, and act on insights required to launch new products, acquire customers, and gain market share. By leveraging the Research Engine, which powers leading insight communities, brands forge connections with their key audiences and harness actionable insights that drive confident business decisions.


At Fuel Cycle, we embrace the values of diversity, equity, and inclusion and are committed to fostering an inclusive company culture. We believe that everyone, regardless of their background or identity, should have equal access to opportunities for growth and advancement. Our selection processes and career pathways are designed to be fair, transparent, and free from bias. We value the unique perspectives and contributions of each team member, knowing that this diverse range of experiences strengthens our team. Fuel Cycle stands firmly against discrimination based on disability, sex, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law.


Fuel Cycle is an equal opportunity employer and fully comply with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). We will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified applicants and employees with disabilities, as needed, to enable them to perform the essential functions of their job and participate in the application and interview process. If you require accommodations during any part of the application process, please contact us at hr@fuelcycle.com to discuss your needs.


Compensation Range: $60K - $65K

title: Tax Director
description:
Reid CPAs, LLP, is an independent, full-service certified public accounting firm specializing in accounting and consulting services for businesses and individuals. We currently have offices in Long Island and NYC. Join a rapidly growing organization with a strategic vision and dynamic plan.


The **Tax Director** is responsible to direct engagements while coordinating with Staff and supervising a team assigned to these engagements. The Tax Director will consult with Partners and engage with clients to develop a rapport by leveraging complex research and analyzation of sophisticated tax strategies.

**Key Objectives:**

* Be proficient in the preparation of various tax returns, including but not limited to – individual, Fiduciary, Corporate, Partnership and Multistate
* Competency in all phases of accounting and tax, including performing tax planning, tax preparation, review, compliance and research
* Demonstrates proficiency through technical knowledge of accounting and reporting standards in areas such as researching, completing, and reviewing technical areas.
* Identifies tax risk management issues and proposes potential solutions through research and collaboration with engagement Partner
* Ability to review tax procedures, and financial statements with no supervision
* Facilitates tax review of returns, and audits for accuracy of data and communication
* Monitors tasks assigned to team ensuring that all questions are answered. Checks for clarity of communication by monitoring tasks, reviewing workflow and ensuring that the team completes all tasks on a timely basis
* Oversees team and coordinates the day-to-day duties of planning, tax work, and wrap-up
* Communicates to Partners any client issues and work status to ensure timeliness
* Supervise, train and mentor tax staff

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in accounting (**Required**)
* CPA **(Required)**
* At least 10 years of experience in a CPA firm with 5 years of supervisory experience
* Experience using UltraTax CS, Checkpoint, Microsoft Office Suite and Intuit products **(Preferred)**
* Ability to work independently and to inspire a team to drive results through efficiencies
* Strong experience using Thomson Reuters UltraTax CS, Checkpoint, Microsoft Office, and Intuit QuickBooks.
* Strong verbal and written communication
* Able to provide positive feedback, constructive direction through proper coaching and mentoring
* Strong attention to detail and time management
* Ability to prioritize and assign tasks based on skill set of team
* High degree of decision making
* Moderate degree of independence
* Consistent communication with Partner, Client and team to ensure that desired results are timely, accurate perceived as positive in nature

**Salary:** Starting at $160,000 (Commensurate with experience)

**Benefits:**

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Vision insurance
* Disability insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off

**Schedule:**

* Monday to Friday in office from 9:00am – 5:30pm with increased hours for busy seasons

* Woodbury, NY 11797: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (**Required**)

title: Director of Engineering, Computer Vision
description:
**About GameChanger:**


We believe in the life-changing impact youth sports have on and off the field because they encourage leadership, teamwork, responsibility, and confidence—important life lessons that have the power to propel our youth toward meaningful futures. We recognize that without coaches, parents, and volunteers, organized youth sports could not exist. By building the first and best place to experience the youth sports moments important to our community, we are helping families elevate the next generation through youth sports.


So if you love sports and their community-building potential, or building cool products is your sport, GameChanger is the team for you. We are a remote-first, dynamic tech company based in New York City, and we are solving some of the biggest challenges in youth sports today.

**The Position:**


As a **Computer Vision Engineering Director**, you will oversee multiple teams of highly skilled engineers building and deploying the next generation of sports tech CV models & applications. You will be responsible for setting the strategic vision for the Computer Vision domain, guiding the technical direction, and scaling the team and infrastructure to meet future demands. You will work closely with cross-functional leaders and senior executives across the organization, and report directly to the Senior Director of Engineering.


The Computer Vision team at GameChanger is rapidly growing and is working on the frontier of placing the power of computer vision into mobile apps for youth sports. As the Engineering Director of the Computer Vision organization at GameChanger, you will be instrumental in shaping the culture and setting the tone for how we build and deliver innovative CV solutions. You will inspire and align teams to our strategic objectives, fostering an environment of collaboration, growth, and high performance. As the organization grows in both size and scope, you will provide oversight and guidance to ensure that teams are empowered and equipped to tackle complex challenges. Your leadership will be key to scaling the group effectively, ensuring that we remain agile and focused on delivering impactful results while maintaining a strong, customer-centric culture.

**What You'll Do:**

* **Provide strategic leadership** to multiple teams of engineers, fostering a high-performance and high-trust environment.
* **Develop and execute a long-term vision** for the Computer Vision domain, aligning with company-wide goals and objectives.
* Collaborate with executive teams, senior leaders, and cross-functional departments to integrate computer vision and machine learning solutions across GameChanger's portfolio.
* Stay up-to-date on state-of-the-art models and techniques, and drive the adoption of new technologies and methodologies within the teams.
* **Champion a culture of innovation and experimentation**, supporting the rapid iteration and deployment of new features and improvements.
* Promote responsible engineering practices across the entire engineering organization, setting standards and ensuring compliance.
* **Mentor and develop engineering managers and senior engineers**, helping them to gain technical breadth and depth, improve judgment, and grow into tomorrow’s leaders.
* Build and lead a diverse team, including backend developers, MLOps, infrastructure engineers, mobile/full-stack engineers, and computer vision specialists, to create a well-rounded and autonomous unit within engineering.

**Who You Are:**

* **5+ years of experience managing teams in the machine learning space**, with a strong preference for computer vision expertise. Experience leading multiple teams or departments is highly desirable.
* **Experience developing and executing strategic plans** in a fast-paced technology environment.
* Excels at developing future leaders. Proven ability to coach Engineering Managers and guiding them in growing their teams and advancing their careers.
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field. **A PhD is a plus.**
* Strong programming skills in Python and experience with popular computer vision and machine learning libraries such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, and OpenCV.
* Extensive experience with all stages of an ML project, from dataset management to model training, iteration, and deployment, including infrastructure to accelerate each stage.
* Proven track record of working in and leading teams in Lean and Agile environments.
* Someone who can inspire and connect people to the mission of serving our users
* **Proven history of delivering impactful products and scaling engineering organizations.**

**Perks:**

* Work remotely throughout the US\\* or from our well-furnished, modern office in Manhattan, NY.
* Unlimited vacation policy.
* Paid volunteer opportunities.
* WFH stipend - $500 annually to make your WFH situation comfortable.
* Snack stipend - $60 monthly to have snacks shipped to your home office.
* Full health benefits - medical, dental, vision, prescription, FSA/HRA., and coverage for family/dependents.
* Life insurance - basic life, supplemental life, and dependent life.
* Disability leave - short-term disability and long-term disability.
* Retirement savings - 401K plan offered through Vanguard, with a company match.
* Company paid access to a wellness platform to support mental, financial, and physical wellbeing.
* Generous parental leave.
* DICK’S Sporting Goods Teammate Discount.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

*The target salary range for this position is between $250,000 and $280,000. This is part of a total compensation package that includes incentive, equity, and benefits for eligible roles. Individual pay may vary from the target range and is determined by several factors including experience, internal pay equity, and other relevant business considerations. We constantly review all teammate pay to ensure a great compensation package that is fair and equal across the board.*

* *DICK'S Sporting Goods has company-wide practices to monitor and protect us from compliance and monetary implications as it pertains to employer state tax liabilities. Due to said guidelines put in place, we are unable to hire in AK, DE, HI, IA, LA, MS, MT, OK, and SC.*

  

Compensation Range: $250K - $280K

title: Experienced Accountant | Tax & Accounting
description:
**About Us**


Our Firm presently consists of five partners with-“Big Four” accounting experience-and a team of committed professionals that take special interest and pride in your success. Our experienced industry teams are committed to provide a high-level of timely, effective and responsive service. Our client base reveals a cross section of industries that include construction, restaurant, not[1]for-profit, governmental, legal, medical, and international and a variety of other businesses including manufacturers, retailers and wholesalers, as well as high net-worth individuals. For each, regardless of size, we assemble a knowledgeable industry team that understands the needs of each client, adds value to the engagement and is able to resolve the most complicated tax or accounting issues effortlessly. Yet, the human touch, attention and partner involvement is second to none.


Mendonca & Partners is headquartered in Union, New Jersey with offices in New York City. It is strategically located within minutes of the Newark International Airport and the Newark/Elizabeth Seaport. In addition, our ideal locations on the Boston[1]Washington corridor, between metropolitan New York City and Philadelphia, make it possible to service our clients timely and efficiently.

title: Tax Partner
description:
We are an independent, full-service certified public accounting firm specializing in accounting and consulting services for businesses and individuals. We currently have offices in Long Island and NYC. Join a rapidly growing organization with a strategic vision and dynamic plan. Tremendous opportunity for a CPA with 10+ years of experience looking to be a partner and to join our dynamic team in our Woodbury, NY office to transition a retiring partner.


This position is for an ambitious individual looking to be a partner in a rapidly growing and successful CPA practice. We would like for this individual to transition a high-volume of write-up/tax clients from a partner planning to retire in a few years.


Candidate should be proficient with general ledger activity and all aspects of tax preparation and planning including sales tax. The ability to develop and maintain client relationships is a must. Individual should have excellent communication skills being able to communicate effectively with clients and staff.

**Key Objectives:**

* Assume responsibility for planning, supervising, and completing engagements.
* Plan the timing and assigning of staff to engagements.
* Supervise and lead Managers, Supervisors, and Staff Accountants, as well as provide feedback to them and evaluate their progress.
* Develop new client contacts and relationships beneficial to the firm.
* Recognize opportunities to provide additional services to existing clients and efficiencies within the workplace.
* Apply knowledge of current issues in tax, regulatory requirements, and industry-specific concerns to clients and be able to identify where they may impact a client and recommend strategies
* Assume responsibility for planning, supervising, and completing engagements.

* Excellent communication skills. Able to communicate effectively with business owners and personnel.
* Possess a positive, can-do attitude with a firm-first mindset and be a team player.
* Strong experience using tax preparation software and Microsoft Office.
* Strong experience using tax software with Thomson Reuters UltraTax CS and/or CCH ProSystem FX, Microsoft Office, and Intuit QuickBooks
* Demonstrate knowledge of prevailing tax laws and developments
* Be proficient in the preparation of various tax returns, including, but not limited to: Individual, Fiduciary, Corporate, Partnership, Sales Tax and Multi states

title: Corporate Social Media Specialist
description:
**About Avaya**
---------------



Businesses are built by the experiences they provide, and every day, millions of those experiences are delivered by Avaya. Organizations trust Avaya to provide innovative solutions for some of their most important ambitions and challenges, giving them the freedom to engage their customers and employees in ways that deliver the greatest business benefits.



Avaya contact center and communications solutions help power immersive, personalized, and unforgettable customer experiences that drive business momentum. With the freedom to choose their journey, there’s no limit to the experiences Avaya customers can create.



The richness of Avaya’s global team diversity is our greatest strength, and we are committed to being a workplace where authenticity and individuality are celebrated and different perspectives are embraced. Learn more at www.avaya.com.

**About The Opportunity**
-------------------------

  

What can you look forward to?  

As a Corporate Social Media Specialist, you will be a key player in crafting and sharing Avaya’s brand story across the globe. We are seeking a creative and innovative thinker who can produce captivating content and engage with our online community. Your role will involve not only creating and managing content but also contributing to the strategic direction of our social media efforts. This position offers the opportunity to shape how we connect with our audiences and build lasting relationships.


What you’ll do:  

* Create compelling content: Develop engaging, thought-provoking content for Avaya’s social media channels, including posts, graphics, and videos, that align with our brand voice and resonate with our audience.
* Manage community interactions: Actively engage with followers, respond to comments and messages, and build positive relationships within our online communities.
* Support strategic initiatives: Assist in the development and execution of the social media content calendar, ensuring alignment with broader marketing and corporate strategies.
* Bring innovative ideas: Monitor social media trends, identify opportunities for engagement, and propose creative approaches to enhance our content and interactions.
* Collaborate across teams: Work with marketing, communications, and other internal teams to ensure cohesive messaging and support campaign objectives.
* Analyze performance: Use social media analytics tools to measure the effectiveness of content, generate insights, and recommend improvements.
* Contribute to campaign success: Support the execution of social media campaigns and initiatives, helping to amplify Avaya’s message and reach.

How the position fits within the organization:  

You’ll report into the Corporate Communications team, which includes global corporate communications, public relations, thought leadership and social media. Within our team, you will work closely with Avaya marketing teams such as Internal Communications, Sales and Partner Communications, Executive Communications, Public Relations and Influencer Relations, and our Solutions Marketing, Campaigns/Demand Gen and Events teams.


**About You**
-------------



What makes you a great fit?  

* Experience: 2-5 years in social media management, preferred organic and paid experience, with a proven track record of developing and executing innovative strategies.
* Education: A bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field -OR- related years of experience in a relevant industry.
* Creative and innovative: Passion for storytelling and a talent for creating visually compelling content that captures attention.
* Strong communicator: Excellent writing and editing skills, with the ability to craft clear, engaging messages for diverse audiences.
* Technically savvy: Familiarity with social media platforms (e.g., LinkedIn, X, Facebook, Instagram) and content creation tools. Basic understanding of SEO and social media advertising.
* Analytical mindset: Ability to interpret data, analyze social media metrics, and apply insights to improve content strategies and engagement.
* Proactive and adaptable: Eager to take initiative, propose new ideas, and adapt to changing circumstances.
* Team-oriented: Collaborative spirit with strong interpersonal skills, comfortable working with cross-functional teams to achieve shared goals.
* Organized and detail-oriented: Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, meet deadlines, and maintain high standards for quality.

**Compensation**
----------------



The pay range for this opportunity is from $76,700 to $103,600 + performance-related bonus + benefits  

This range represents the anticipated low and high end of the salary for this position. This role is also eligible to receive an annual bonus that aligns with individual and company performance. Actual salaries will vary and are based on factors such as a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, and location.  

If your expectations fall outside of this range, but you are interested in this position we’d love to hear from you! Humans, not ‘bots’ screen your application, so please still consider applying and take the opportunity to explain your reason for applying in the relevant section on your application and include a cover letter to give us more insight into why you are interested, alongside attaching your up-to-date resume of course. Please also register for email notifications here so that you can be among the first to be informed of any new roles matching your search criteria.


Our Benefits include:


* Well-Being We provide comprehensive health insurance plans that include medical, dental and vision for you and your family, in many countries. We also provide wellness and employee assistance programs.


* Recharge & Refuel We work in a dynamic environment, and we recognize the need for you to take a break and recharge. We encourage employees to use our generous time-off policy on a regular basis.


* Continuous Learning Grow your skills with access to on-demand platforms and enhance your diversity lens by participating in a program that fully funds you for a cultural immersion in another country.


* Growth & Development A feedback loop is important as you grow in your role and career. We schedule frequent check-ins with you and your leaders to help you identify your path to success.


* Giving Back We recognize Avayans for their time and effort spent impacting causes within their communities. And we host an annual, company-wide Month of Giving.

title: Registered Nurse (MedSurgGlens)
description:
**Job Title:** Registered Nurse (RN) – Med-Surg / T3 Glens

**Location:** New York ,NY

**Position Type:** Contract

**Job Summary:**

We are seeking a dedicated and compassionate Registered Nurse (RN) to join our Med-Surg team at the T3 Glens Unit. The ideal candidate will have experience in a Medical-Surgical setting and be responsible for providing high-quality patient care, assessing patient conditions, and implementing appropriate nursing interventions. This role involves collaborating with a multidisciplinary team to deliver comprehensive care to patients with a wide range of medical conditions.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Provide direct and individualized nursing care to patients based on their medical condition and treatment plan.
* Monitor and assess patient health status, including vital signs, and respond promptly to changes.
* Administer medications, treatments, and procedures in compliance with hospital policies and protocols.
* Collaborate with the healthcare team, including physicians, therapists, and other nurses, to develop and implement patient care plans.
* Educate patients and their families on health conditions, medications, and discharge instructions.
* Maintain accurate and detailed patient records, including documentation of patient care, observations, and medical history.
* Ensure a safe, clean, and supportive environment for patients, families, and staff.
* Utilize critical thinking and decision-making skills in clinical situations to achieve optimal patient outcomes.
* Participate in ongoing professional development and training to maintain current knowledge and skills in nursing practice.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:** Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) or Associate Degree in Nursing (ADN) from an accredited nursing program.
* **Licensure:** Active and unrestricted Registered Nurse (RN) license in [State].
* **Experience:** Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in a Medical-Surgical (Med-Surg) unit or similar clinical setting.
* **Certifications:** Basic Life Support (BLS) and Advanced Cardiovascular Life Support (ACLS) certification required.
* **Skills:** Strong clinical skills, excellent communication, and interpersonal skills, ability to work in a fast-paced environment, and proficiency in electronic medical records (EMR) systems.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Previous experience in the T3 Glens Unit or similar specialized Med-Surg unit.
* Certification in Med-Surg nursing (CMSRN) or other relevant specialty certifications.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Ability to stand, walk, and bend for extended periods.
* Ability to lift and move patients and equipment as needed.
* Ability to work in a high-stress environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
* Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
* Supportive and collaborative team environment.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $80.00 - $90.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Work Location: On the road

title: Immigration Paralegal
company: Law Offices of Spar & Bernstein, P.C.
description:
**About Us:** Join our dynamic and growing law firm, where we specialize in providing top-tier immigration services. Our firm is dedicated to helping clients navigate the complexities of immigration law with compassion and professionalism. We are looking for an experienced and detail-oriented Immigration Paralegal to join our team.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Assist attorneys in the preparation and filing of immigration petitions, applications, and legal documents.
* Conduct legal research and stay up-to-date on the latest immigration laws, regulations, and procedures.
* Prepare and compile supporting documents for various immigration cases, including family-based, employment-based, and humanitarian visas.
* Communicate with clients to gather necessary information, provide case updates, and address any concerns.
* Maintain and organize client files, ensuring all documents are properly filed and easily accessible.
* Draft legal correspondence and forms, ensuring accuracy and compliance with legal standards.
* Coordinate and schedule client interviews, hearings, and appointments with USCIS and other immigration agencies.
* Monitor case status and deadlines, ensuring timely submission of all required documentation.
* Assist in preparing clients for interviews and hearings, providing them with guidance and support.
* Collaborate with the legal team to develop case strategies and achieve positive outcomes for clients.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 2 years of experience as an Immigration Paralegal or in a related legal field.
* Strong knowledge of U.S. immigration laws, procedures, and forms.
* Proficiency in legal research and writing.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to manage multiple cases and deadlines simultaneously.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Proficiency in using legal software and Microsoft Office Suite.
* Bilingual skills (especially in Spanish) are a plus.

**Why Join Us:**

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunities for professional development and growth.
* Supportive and collaborative work environment.
* The chance to make a meaningful impact in clients' lives.

Pay: $65,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Ability to Commute:

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10007: Relocate before starting work (Required)
